entry.title: SAP Joule for Beginners: Everything You Need to Know - All at one stop!
entry.content:
This blog is for anyone in the SAP domain — from consultants to architects — who is curious about SAP Joule and wants to understand how it works. You're in the right place!

Disclaimer: This blog is based on publicly available information as of 24th July 2025, along with my personal interpretation. Sources of all referenced information, where available, are quoted in the REFERENCE section of this blog.

Topics covered in this blog are:

Welcome to the world of SAP Joule! Let's decode it into chunks! 

"How can I help you? 

Talk to me naturally. For example, 'What are my task for today?"

 

This is how Joule greets you in first place!

Joule — a name derived from the unit of energy — is here to energize our business processes, save valuable time, and simplify even the most tedious tasks resulting in greater efficiency and a noticeable uplift in the quality of our work.

SECTION 1: Understanding key terminologies and concepts:

Let’s cover some basic artificial intelligence terms before diving deeper into Joule for better understanding.

  • Artificial intelligence (AI) is a technology that mimics human reasoning and behavior, enabling machines to make decisions on their own. By processing large volumes of data, AI can understand speech, identify patterns and trends, solve problems proactively, and forecast future outcomes.

  • GenAI also known as generative AI is a model where it can create new content which can either be text, image, audio and video based on the existing content that it already has.

  • LLM (Large language Model) is the specific model (like GPT, PaLM, LLaMA) that powers the text generation part of GenAI. It is a type of artificial intelligence model that is trained to understand and generate human-like language. It's designed to read, summarize, translate, predict, or generate text based on the input it receives. Eg, When we ask ChatGPT a question, it's an LLM that's interpreting our text and generating a relevant, natural-sounding response.

  • AI copilot is a virtual assistant that helps business application users complete tasks more easily through a conversational interface. It uses generative AI to understand requests, take actions, and offer insights from business data. AI Copilots use LLMs to understand natural language and assist users in real time.The answer that is provided to the user is limited to training data against LLMs. "Large" refers to the massive amount of data and the billions of parameters the model is trained on.

  • Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG): In SAP world, customer specific data cannot be used to train the LLMs. And hence we need a better way to retrieve the desired outcomes without breaching the customer's data privacy. This is where RAG comes into picture. It is used to generate more relevant answers to an SAP user's question without actually training the Large Language Model (LLM). This is done through Document Grounding. As a part of preparation of RAG, it provided with SAP and customer specific documents such as HR policies, manuals, and SOPs that may be useful for answering SAP user queries. These documents are then chunked into smaller parts and are then embedded into dense, continuous vectors—known as embeddings—which represent the data in a high-dimensional space. These embeddings are then stored in the HANA Vector Database for retrieval based on the user's query. This information is passed to the LLM as prompts during runtime rather than getting it trained. The LLM uses this prompt to generate a response in real time. Thus, LLMs are not trained against customer data. Rather, they get Grounded against customer specific data. 

  • HANA Vector Database enables the storage, indexing, and searching of unstructured data like vector embeddings (numerical representations of text, documents, or images). This allows AI systems to retrieve and interpret information based on semantic meaning, not just keywords.

    Image source: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Uiv29xYlXvQ

  • For example, company policy documents are broken into chunks and converted into multi-dimensional vectors (numerical coordinates that represent the meaning of text) using an AI model. These vectors, along with metadata, are stored in the SAP HANA Vector Database to enable semantic search, so RAG can retrieve relevant content for the LLM to generate accurate natural language responses. For instance, when a user asks about their company's paternity leave policy, the system converts the question into a vector, searches for the most relevant policy content using the HANA Vector Database, and then uses an LLM to generate a clear answer based on that information.

SECTION 2: What is SAP Joule and what are its use cases in the SAP world

SAP Joule is an AI copilot from SAP. Powered by SAP BTP (Business Technology Platform), it serves as a virtual assistant that leverages generative AI to understand and respond to user requests within SAP systems.

Before diving deeper, Let's understand some of the use cases of SAP Joule. Below are some of the end-user prompts that can be sent to Joule, where it responds appropriately using natural language processing. These examples are sourced from SAP's official Joule product pages.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Image source: https://www.sap.com/india/products/artificial-intelligence/ai-assistant.html#agility-for-all

Why Joule?

Joule is SAP domain-specific and is integrated with SAP’s suite of products, ensuring seamless interaction and data exchange across the SAP portfolio. It is also a responsible AI solution, with a strong emphasis on industry-specific regulations and standards. As a result, Joule is a more Relevant, Reliable, and Responsible AI copilot for SAP.

As specified earlier, the LLMs in Joule are not actually trained to respond to SAP user queries. Instead, Joule use document grounding through RAGe (Retrieval-Augmented Generation for enterprise) for unstructured data, and the SAP Knowledge Graph for structured data, enabling it to provide more comprehensive responses by referencing business documents from both SAP and third-party repositories , while LLMs are used to add natural language rather than the actual context in the response that is sent to user by Joule. That is, Grounding uses a customer’s own knowledge sources (e.g., travel policies, enablement content, service manuals, FAQs, etc.) to supplement the capabilities of Large language models (LLMs). This gives Joule a unique understanding of SAP data and processes, allowing it to respond more reliably than any other AI copilot.

Joule is seamlessly integrated into various SAP cloud solutions to help users work more efficiently across different business functions, such as:

  • SAP S/4HANA Cloud

  • SAP S/4HANA Cloud, private edition

  • SAP SuccessFactors

  • SAP Ariba

  • SAP Sales Cloud

  • SAP Customer Experience solutions

  • SAP Concur

  • SAP ABAP Cloud

However, it is worth noting that Joule is not available for on-premise solutions.

Thus the main advantages of SAP Joule include:

  • Enhanced decision-making

  • Accelerated end-to-end business processes

  • Personalized UI with inherited user authorizations

  • Advanced analytics

  • Contextual awareness

  • Ability to meet diverse business needs

Business application supported by SAP Joule:

SAP Joule runs on the AI Foundation of SAP BTP (Business Technology Platform) and supports a wide range of business application such as Finance, Procurement, Supply Chain, Human Resources, Sales and Services, Marketing and E-Commerce, Development, and Consulting.  Apart from some of the use cases described before, a detailed list of business use cases are available through URL => https://www.sap.com/india/products/artificial-intelligence/use-cases.html

Joule's interaction pattern:

 

 

 

 

 

 

Image source: https://www.sap.com/india/products/artificial-intelligence/ai-assistant.html

Joule's interaction pattern can vary from:

  1. Informational: The Joule provides answers to factual questions (e.g. "What are the key rules for a team outing?")

  2. Navigational: The Joule guides users through a multi-step process or an internal journey, like approving a request or changing organizational data. (e.g. “Where in the app do I send a promotion request?”)

  3. Transactional: The Joule engages in task completion workflows, e.g. reviewing and updating position details (job title, department, cost center), then confirming by saying “Done”. It also supports user edits and next steps before finalizing. (e.g. “Update the position title to Sustainability Supply Chain Consultant — ready to submit?”)

  4. Analytical: The Joule offers data insights, metrics, and visual analytics, such as attrition trends vs. hiring rates charted by quarter. It helps users interpret numbers and trends. (e.g.“What was our quarterly attrition rate in 2024?”)

SECTION 3: Joule architecture

Image source: Joule learning journey 

Joule architecture consists of key components which work together to respond to a user's question.

  1. Scenario Catalog: The Scenario Catalog holds information about all the available scenarios, functions, and skills in SAP cloud applications. In helps to distinguish between different user questions and guides Joule to understand the request and connect it to the right action or system or workflow. This acts like a blueprint that maps user queries to the appropriate actions, destinations, or logic within SAP systems. For example, if a user query is "Retrieves the current leave balance for a given employee", then this gets mapped as below:
    1. Scenario: 'Get_Employee_Leave_Balance'
    2. Business application : Human Resource
    3. 'leave balance': Employee ID, leave Type and Date Range.
  2. Knowledge Catalog: This contains SAP-knowledge as well as the customer-owned knowledge. It is a collection of documents and content sources (often unstructured or semi-structured) that are made available to Joule for question-answering using RAG (Retrieval-Augmented Generation) techniques. It supports Joule in answering open-ended, natural language questions that aren’t directly tied to structured data or APIs. For example, it can have a company's HR policies (e.g., leave, travel, benefits), Finance guidelines (e.g., expense reimbursement rules) and so on. These documents are chunked and vectorized using embeddings in HANA vector database as specified earlier. When a user asks a related question, Joule retrieves relevant chunks and sends them to the LLM to generate a grounded answer.
  3. User Context: This helps joule to contextualize a user's question. This includes information about the SAP cloud applications the user is currently using, along with any additional SAP applications the customer has licensed and activated for use with Joule. Joule also recognizes the user’s roles and permissions, ensuring they can access only the information or perform the actions they are authorized to within the SAP cloud environment. Additionally, Joule takes into account the user’s chat history and context to provide most relevant and accurate responses to user queries. To put in other words, a user will be able to view or perform any tasks only if they are authorized to do so based on their existing authorization. 
  4. Document Grounding: Large Language Models (LLMs) are generally capable of understanding prompts and generating human-like responses. However, they often lack the context and specificity needed for business scenarios. To address this, Joule uses a technique called document grounding. This allows Joule to generate more accurate and relevant responses by referencing business documents stored in SAP and third-party repositories. As part of document grounding, customers can upload their own content (such as HR policies, travel policies, service manuals, etc.). When an end user asks a question, Joule searches these documents for relevant information and returns a concise, natural-language response, including the source references. This ensures the answers are grounded in the customer's own structured and unstructured data, making them more trustworthy and context-aware.
  5.  Grounding: This is the process of combining generative LLMs with advanced information retrieval techniques to enhance the accuracy and relevance of responses—without the need to train or fine-tune the model on company-specific data. It leverages a customer’s internal knowledge sources (e.g., policies, FAQs, training material) to supplement the LLM’s existing knowledge. This improves the model’s reliability and ensures that responses reflect the customer’s unique business context.
  6. Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG): RAG is used to generate more relevant answers to an SAP user's question without actually training the Large Language Model (LLM). As part of the RAG, Document Grounding is performed. In this step, RAG is provided with relevant documents such as HR policies, manuals, and SOPs that may be useful for answering SAP user queries. These documents are chunked into smaller parts and then embedded into dense, continuous vectors—known as embeddings—which represent the data in a high-dimensional space. These embeddings are then stored in the HANA Vector Database for retrieval based on the user's query.
  7.  HANA Vector Database: It enables the storage, indexing, and searching of unstructured data like vector embeddings (numerical representations of text, documents, or images). This allows AI systems to retrieve and interpret information based on semantic meaning, not just keywords. For example, company policy documents are broken into chunks and converted into multi-dimensional vectors (numerical coordinates that represent the meaning of text) using an AI model. These vectors, along with metadata, are stored in the SAP HANA Vector Database to enable semantic search, so RAG can retrieve relevant content for the LLM to generate accurate natural language responses. When a user asks about their leave balance, the system converts the question into a vector, searches for the most relevant policy content using the HANA Vector Database, and then uses an LLM to generate a clear answer based on that information.
  8.  Knowledge Graph: This graph is a semantic network that connects entities (like customers, products, orders, employees, etc.) and defines how they are related. This helps Joule go beyond keyword matching or document lookup. It actually lets Joule "understand" business context and structure.  Joule uses the graph to understand how different entities are linked (e.g., “Employee X belongs to Department Y” or “Invoice A is tied to Purchase Order B”). With this, Joule disambiguate questions and provide more accurate answers.  It also enables logical inferences, like “Show me all open invoices for suppliers in Germany”, “List products related to a delayed shipment” etc. Even if the data is spread across multiple systems, the graph can link them together efficiently.

 

 

Image sources: Knowledge Graph or Vector Database… Which is Better? and  GraphRAG: The Marriage of Knowledge Graphs and RAG: Emil Eifrem

NOTE: While RAG brings in document-based context and vector search finds the right text chunks, the Knowledge Graph brings in structure and relationship-based logic. Eg: RAG may find a document about a purchase policy, but the Knowledge Graph helps determine which department owns that policy and who can approve it.

Does LLM gets trained with SAP's data?

When SAP’s AI assistant Joule interacts with a Large Language Model (LLM), it doesn’t send data for storage or training. Instead, it shares information only briefly, as part of a prompt during runtime. The LLM uses this prompt to generate a response in real time, but it doesn’t remember or learn from what it receives. Thus, LLMs are not trained against customer data.

Joule's orchestration layer:

Image source: Examining how to onboard and extend Joule | AI105

Steps involved within Joule for processing user query:

  1. User submits query in natural language via Joule client in SAP cloud apps
  2. The prompt is sent to the Dialogue Management system, which manages the conversation flow and understands the user's intent.
  3. The Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) service forms a semantic vector search query based on the user input.
  4. This query is executed against a Vector Database where document embeddings are stored. The relevant document extracts are retrieved. These embeddings were created earlier from company-specific or SAP documents using document grounding
  5. The retrieved document snippets are passed along with the original prompt to a Large Language Model. The LLM uses the relevant extracts to ground its response (ensuring the response is based on actual documents, not hallucinations).
  6. The LLM generates a natural-language answer, grounded in the retrieved documents.
  7. The final answer is displayed to the user with source links and supporting documents attached.->Example: A link to a company travel policy PDF is shown under “Source Document”.

For more information, refer to Provisioning and Implementing Joule learning journey 

Deep dive into SAP Joule possible workflow to respond to any user prompt

Below is a scenario which is explained in SAP joule product page specified below where a sales manager who is logged into SAP Sales Cloud, sees that there is an upcoming meeting with a customer called MDT. She takes help of joules to get below information.

Please do watch the video below which depicts Joule in action before proceeding further.

Introducing Joule - The AI copilot that truly understands your business 

USE CASE 1: Ask Joule to provide details about this customer so that she can be prepared or the meeting.

CAUTION ! The below flow is only for illustration purpose as of how Joule MIGHT respond based on my assumptions. It must be used only for understanding purpose.

USE CASE 2: She also asks Joules to extract the customer requirement by pasting the email in Joule prompt

Workflow of use case 2:  The user shares a business email requesting a product recommendation for an industrial robot. This is a semi-structured prompt. Joule extracts the requirements from this text, matches it to product data, and provides a recommendation with pricing, configuration, and confidence level.

CAUTION ! The below flow is only for illustration purpose as of how Joule MIGHT respond based on my assumptions.It must be used only for understanding purpose.

USE CASE 3: User asks Joule about the expense limit for business meals in Germany

Workflow of use case 3: 

CAUTION ! The below flow is only for illustration purpose as of how Joule MIGHT respond based on my assumptions.It must be used only for understanding purpose.

We can infer that most of the structured user queries are predominantly handled by SAP Knowledge graph while unstructured queries are handled through RAG which in turn works with HANA Vector Database.

SECTION 4: Joule packages and pricing: Base and premium

Joules comes in 2 different packages for consumption:

  1. Joule Base (No additional cost involved)
  2. Joule Premium

A. SAP Joule Base package: 

Joule Base package is available as supplement to all eligible SAP cloud subscriptions at no additional cost. As a prerequisite customer must have an active subscription to a supported SAP cloud product (e.g., SAP SuccessFactors). 

Current entitlements:

  1. Joule for developers, ABAP AI capabilities: To accelerate ABAP development with Joule
  2. Joule with SAP Fieldglass solutions: Enhance efficiencies across hiring processes with AI
  3. Joule with SAP LeanIX: Search and navigate to the right information through natural language queries.
  4. Joule with SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition: Streamline the informational, navigational, and transactional tasks.
  5. Joule with SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition: Streamline the informational, navigational, and transactional tasks.

Features:

  1. Provides access to a base set of Joule’s AI functions.
  2. Supports navigation, information retrieval, and basic task assistance within SAP cloud solutions.
  3. Unlimited usage under a flat fee model.

Joule is a central service and hence customer must choose the SAP BTP global account to attach Joule to in case of base package.  For more information on this regard, please refer to links below.

  • AI Catalog - Joule Base
  • SAP Joule Base Entitlement

B. SAP Joule Premium package: 

Joule Premium enhances the Joule Base with domain-specific and agentic AI features. It is available as a paid add-on through AI Units.

Premium Packages by Business applications(as on date 25th July 25):

  1. Joule Premium for financial management: Delivers deep financial insights and smart summarizations tailored for finance users. It brings in agent-driven capabilities that cover both transactional and analytical needs — helping finance teams make better, faster decisions.
  2. Joule Premium for spend management: With features like Category Segmentation and Statement of Work (SOW) Description Generation, Joule Premium supports procurement and finance functions in improving efficiency and streamlining sourcing processes.
  3. Joule Premium for supply chain management: Enhances supply chain visibility with intelligent tools such as Equipment Insights and ESG Report Generation — boosting transparency and operational awareness across logistics and asset-heavy processes.
  4.  Joule Premium for human capital management: HR teams can benefit from AI-Assisted Writing, Interview Feedback Insights, and other intelligent capabilities that help improve talent processes, communications, and candidate engagement.
  5. Joule Premium for customer experience: Designed to enhance customer engagement, Joule Premium in CX includes innovative features like Image Generation and Lead Booster to drive personalized interactions and improved conversions.
  6. SAP Joule for Consultants: SAP Joule empowers consultants with expert-level AI guidance, helping them accelerate SAP cloud deployments and ensure higher implementation quality and productivity.
  7. Joule for Developers: Joule acts as a real-time AI assistant for SAP developers, offering on-the-fly explanations of development objects, quick answers to dev-related queries, and seamless learning support.

Costing involved with Premium packages: AI Units

SAP Joules premium packages can be bought from the AI Catalog of Discovery center. URL:https://discovery-center.cloud.sap/ai-catalog 

These are priced based on AI Units, which serve as a virtual currency that can be used across all SAP cloud products and lines of business through a shared AI Unit pool. AI Units are calculated based on predefined business metrics (e.g., transactions, pages, users, expenses), with each metric having its own conversion rate (e.g., 1 transaction = X AI Units). 

Purchasing premium licenses typically includes a fixed number of Joule messages per year (e.g., RISE with SAP S/4HANA Cloud Premium includes approximately 2,500 messages). A single message refers to one user ask and the corresponding Joule response. Any usage beyond the included quota will consume additional AI Units.SAP provides an AI Unit Estimator Tool to help estimate AI Unit requirements based on selected capabilities and transaction volume. A quote can be requested directly through the estimator.

Below is a sample screenshot from the Discovery Center showing how to search for the package. It also displays the list of functionalities available under 'Joule Premium for Human Capital Management'. To purchase a specific functionality within this package, click on the corresponding tile to view its estimate and understand the pricing.

SECTION 5: Joule functionalities that is targeted at technology consultants

Two of the Joule premium that can help technology consultants are Joule for Consultants and Joule for developers.

A. Joule for Consultants:

SAP Joule for Consultants is a conversational AI solution that speeds up SAP cloud transformations by providing expert guidance drawn from SAP’s most extensive and carefully curated knowledge base.

Key uses:

  1. It is designed to reduce substantial amount of search time.
  2.  It helps to interpret custom code faster.
  3. It avoids rework and helps with improving the quality of work.

To enable Joule for Consultant kick start using the mission Enable SAP Joule for Consultants .

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Some of the use cases of this product as described in SAP product page at URL SAP Joule for Consultants are:

B. Joule for Developers: 

Joule for developers is part of SAP's Build portfolio. The primary objective of SAP Build is to enable citizen developers (business or end users) to build applications, processes, and business websites through visual drag-and-drop elements. It also helps professional developers accelerate development by generating data models, services, UI components, sample data, and business logic using Joule prompts.

NOTE: Joule with SAP Build is available as part of trial account or free tier. Upcoming SAP build details will have links to exercises that can be tried out with SAP BTP trial account.

Key components of SAP Build are:

  1. SAP Build Apps: SAP Build Apps helps both business users and developers quickly create and customize applications using low-code, AI assistance, and reusable modules—ensuring fast, collaborative development across SAP and non-SAP systems.

  2. SAP Build Code: SAP Build Code is a powerful generative AI–based code development environment for professional developers, offering end-to-end support for Java and JavaScript, AI-assisted coding with Joule, and a streamlined experience for collaborative SAP development across both expert and citizen developers. It provides a turnkey environment for coding, testing, integrations, and application lifecycle management.
  3. SAP Build Process Automation: SAP Build Process Automation lets both business users and developers automate workflows without coding, using drag-and-drop tools, AI, and pre-built content—boosting productivity, enabling collaboration, and running securely on SAP Business Technology Platform.
  4. SAP Build Work Zone: SAP Build Work Zone is a user-friendly platform that brings together apps, tools, and content in one place to help employees work smarter and stay informed by building digital workspaces & sites.
  5. SAP Build Content Catalog: Prebuilt business content & templates that can be reused during application build.

A. Joule and SAP Build Code: 

Below screen shot depicts how Joule is able to generate data sets, sample data, logic and so on using AI.

For more information check the learning journey and git hub for sample application creation detailed steps.

C. SAP Build Work Zone: 

Below screen shots depicts how a business site can be created using drag and drop options with built in icons and buttons.

Follow below tutorial to create business websites.

D. SAP Build App: 

Below screen shot shows how a citizen developers (Business or end users) can build a Mobile front-end application through drag and drop options within 20 mins.

SECTION 6: Other important links and references

  1. Joule for SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition - A Comprehensive Setup Guide 
  2. Activate Joule with SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 
  3. Activate Joule for SAP SuccessFactors

Thus, Joule is DECODED!
Thanks for making until here! Hope I was able to help!
 
Rajarajeswari Kaliyaperumal

entry.title: Joule功能全景介绍：Joule在SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition中的核心功能与应用
entry.content:
在快速变化的商业环境中，效率和智能化是企业成功的关键。SAP的智能副驾Joule在SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition中扮演重要角色，旨在通过自然语言交互帮助用户高效完成任务、获取信息和管理业务对象。本文将深入探讨Joule的关键功能及其应用场景。

Joule不仅是聊天机器人，更是能理解用户意图、协助完成复杂业务流程的智能助手。其核心能力分为五类：信息查询、应用导航，事务处理，分析功能以及代理功能。

 

以下将为您深入介绍Joule在SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition中的主要功能及其核心应用场景：

 

​​• 导航功能 (Navigational Capability)​​

  • ​​作用​​: Joule帮助用户定位与任务最相关的应用程序。
  • ​​应用场景​​: 用户可通过描述需执行任务或查找对象向Joule提出请求。Joule提供导航至常用应用程序的建议。

  • ​​示例问题​​:
    • “我在哪个应用中可以创建采购订单？”
    • “如何上传供应商发票？”
    • “查找用于分析日记账分录的应用”
    • “在哪里可以为物料AB0123创建采购订单？”
    • “显示用于定义‘咨询’活动的成本率的应用”
  • ​​前提条件​​: 访问Joule建议的应用需用户拥有相应的业务目录权限。

​​• 信息功能 (Informational Capability)​​

  • ​​作用​​: Joule通过分析总结SAP帮助门户信息，提供简洁、有依据的问题答案。其评估问题，检索相关文章，利用大型语言模型分析并总结结果，提供相关文章链接。
  • ​​应用场景​​: 对话中获取关于应用程序、产品功能等查询的有依据回复。

  • ​​示例问题​​:
    • “什么是免费销售订单？”
    • “服务订单和服务合同之间有什么区别？”
    • “如何配置采购订单的灵活工作流？”
  • ​​额外功能​​: Joule可引导用户至相关应用或在需要时代为执行操作。

​​• 事务处理功能 (Transactional Capabilities)​​

  • ​​作用​​: Joule使您能够访问后端系统并管理业务任务。您可以在对话中直接查看和处理业务对象，而无需离开对话界面并执行操作，从而简化工作流程并减少获取洞察所需的时间。

                  

  • 应用场景
    • 查看业务数据 (Viewing Business Data)​​:
      • 无需打开相关应用，您可以在Joule聊天窗口中直接显示业务对象详细数据,比如要求Joule显示如采购订单状态、采购申请项目等详细信息。
      • 目前该模式已支持采购订单、销售订单、供应商发票、检验方法、主检验特性、流程订单等共计34类业务对象（完整列表详见帮助文档）
      • 示例问题：
      • 显示逾期采购订单项
      • 显示尚未交货的销售订单​
      • 获取计划开始日期为2026年的生产订单
      • 获取我创建的生产订单确认

 

    • ​​创建洞察卡 (Creating Insights Cards)​​:
      • 该功能支持您在Joule输入查询后，显示列表和洞察的快照，用户满意可将卡片添加至“我的主页”
      • 支持的应用示例有：供应商发票列表（版本2）、管理采购订单（版本2）、管理销售订单、维护物料清单、查找维护订单、管理采购申请等。

 

    • 财务领域：创建固定资产主数据 (Creating Fixed Asset Master Data)​​:
  • 该功能支持您在Joule内创建固定资产主数据记录。
  • 您可以要求Joule创建单个资产主记录，并提供公司代码、成本中心、资产类别及可选资产描述。当信息不全时，Joule会引导创建过程，请求补充信息。
  • 示例对话：
    • 用户：“请创建一个固定资产”
    • Joule: 请提供以下信息公司代码（Company Code）,资产类别（Asset Class）,成本中心（Cost Center）资产描述（Asset Description）
    • 用户提供详情如“1010, 3200, 10101041, 笔记本电脑ABC”。

 

 

  • ​​销售领域：检查和续订即将到期的价格 (Renew Expiring Prices)​​:
    • 该功能可以帮助您管理即将到期的价格（存储为销售定价条件记录），您可以要求Joule查询即将到期价格，按日期/时间范围过滤。可延长有效期至新日期或延长一段时间（如30天、一周、三个季度或一年），也可按百分比调整条件金额或比率。
    • 示例请求：“显示2025年5月1日到期的PPR0和PCP0条件类型的价格”、“延长有效日期一个月并调整条件金额-10%”

 

  • ​​销售订单状态检查 (Sales Order Status Check)​​:
    • 该功能可以帮助销售代表或经理检查销售订单履行状态，识别阻碍问题。如存在问题，Joule可显示问题数量、最早到期日、可能原因、处理建议等，并可打开相关销售订单应用。
    • 示例请求：“销售订单12345的状态是什么？”、“销售订单12345有什么问题吗？”

 

  • 代理能力 (Agentic Capabilities)
    • 作用：Joule能够自主地与环境互动，并通过多步任务迭代推理以实现目标，具备规划、反思、工具使用以及协作和多代理等关键能力。您可以关注SAP 的产品路线图来查看代理功能的具体落地日期。
  • 分析能力 (Analytical Capabilities)
    • Joule也将在未来版本中提供基于业务数据的分析能力，能够为用户提供见解。这部分的功能尚在开发中，您可以关注SAP 的产品路线图来查看有关分析功能的最新信息。

​​Joule的技术架构与访问要求​​


Joule作为独立软件组件，通过 ​​SAP Business Technology Platform (BTP)​​ 以 ​​SaaS（软件即服务）​​ 形式管理和更新，支持集中式设置，实现跨连接应用的统一用户体验。

​​许可和授权：要访问SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition中的Joule，可能需要额外的许可和授权。建议咨询您的SAP客户经理以获取更多信息。

业务目录要求：为了能够访问Joule提议的应用程序或使用其特定功能，您的用户需要被分配相应的业务目录（business catalogs）。

 

Joule的未来与扩展性

Joule目前支持以11种语言显示工作内容，未来还将支持更多语言。

 Joule还具备强大的可扩展性，允许通过自定义技能、低代码平台和第三方连接进行扩展。Joule studio在SAP Build中提供，助力您根据特定需求扩展Joule的功能。

更值得一提的是，Joule的AI辅助文档接地 (Document Grounding)功能，能够结合推理能力，利用您自己的非结构化或半结构化文档（如HR政策文档）来回答用户问题。它通过将大型语言模型 (LLM) 与高级信息检索相结合，增强响应质量和准确性，最大程度地减少“幻觉”，并建立信任、减少歧义。

Joule在SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition中，不仅仅是一个工具，更是一个智能化的业务搭档。它将繁琐的导航、信息查找和部分事务处理任务，转化为直观的自然语言对话，极大地提升了用户体验和工作效率。

感谢阅读。

entry.title: Joule in SAP Ariba Applications
entry.content:
Joule is the SAP AI copilot - a virtual assistant that uses a conversational interface to help users of SAP business applications complete tasks more efficiently.

The conversational interface is brought to life with the help of these 4 interaction patterns:

  • With informational interactions we are providing our users knowledge-based results. All SAP applications in which Joule is available make their knowledge-base available via Joule, e.g. SAP Help Documentation. This is managed by SAP and offered to every Joule user out of the box.
    We‘re also bringing in Document Grounding with which we enable our customers to upload their customer-owned content, e.g. HR-policies, travel-policies, FAQs, and others, so that their users can ask questions based on these documents.

 

  • Navigational Pattern - Easily navigate SAP applications by simply asking via natural language. Joule offers you a navigational link which opens the respective application and UI in a new browser tab. In the destination, a user can open Joule again and continue where they have left with the same conversation history.

 

  • Transactional interactions provide our users with a direct entry point to the backend system. Triggering and influencing business processes with the power of natural language and AI. E.g. purchase orders which need to be reviewed and approved, job positions which are created or any other CRUD-interaction (create, read, update, delete) within SAP cloud applications.

 

  • And a 4th, Analytical pattern to enable analytical interactions based on JustAsk and SAP Analytics Cloud, enabling customers to leverage Joule for analytical queries. This is currently not implemented in Ariba.

With the Q3 2025 release, Joule is being made available in the SAP Ariba applications of Guided Buying, Guided Sourcing and Supplier Management.

Please note that AI copilot Joule in the aforementioned products will be in Early Access until September 19th, 2025 at which time it will be made generally available to customers.

Below is the complete list of Transactional and Navigational Joule skills which are available per application area.

1. Guided Buying

Available Transactional Joule Skills

  • Get Status of Purchase Requisition – Displays the status of a specific PR
  • Show recent purchase requisitions – Displays a list of the last 10 PRs
  • Show Approvers of PR
  • Show Shipping Details
  • Show PR Details – Displays line item information of a specified PR

Available Navigational Joule Skills

  • View Requisition

2. Guided Sourcing

Available Transactional Joule Skills

  • List Sourcing Events - Displays the list of sourcing events created within a specified number of past days.
  • Return RFx status of a sourcing event – Displays the status of a specific event ID
  • Return approval status of a sourcing event – Displays the status of an approval task for the specified event
  • Send reminder email to Suppliers
  • Retrieve Supplier Invitation Details
  • Retrieve Event Timing or Event Rules
  • Display pending approvals
  • Approval Processing
  • Sourcing Approval Status Check
  • Retrieve Supplier Bids
  • Retrieve Supplier Bid Details

Available Navigational Joule Skills

  • Go to My Tasks
  • Go to For You page
  • Go to Sourcing Event
  • Go to Request Creation page

3. Supplier Management

Available Transactional Joule Skills

  • Show Primary Contact Information of Supplier – Displays contact details of Supplier
  • List Suppliers ‘In Registration’ status - Displays a list of suppliers that have started the registration process but haven't submitted questionnaires for a specific number of days.
  • List Suppliers ‘Invited’ status – Displays a list of the Suppliers that have been invited to register but haven’t responded to the invitation for a specific number of days

Available Navigational Joule Skills

  • Navigate to get Suppliers in Registration status
  • Navigate to get Suppliers in Invited status

Additionally, the Informational pattern is also available for the 3 applications which means Joule can assist users with your product-related questions by finding answers in the product documentation published on the SAP Help Portal. Along with an excerpt, it provides direct links to the relevant source documents, allowing you to explore the details further.

 

COSTING 

All the above mentioned Joule skills are part of Joule base, which means you will not be charged any AI units for these. 

You should have enabled either of the below Joule SKUs from SAP store

  • Joule Base SKU: 8019544
  • Joule Premium SKU (includes AI Units): 8019164

 

MULTI-LANGUAGE SUPPORT 

Joule will be able to understand and respond to queries in the following languages - English, German, French, Spanish, Portuguese, Japanese, Korean, Chinese, Vietnamese, Greek, Polish.

 

PREREQUISITES

Joule leverages the SAP Business Technology Platform to simplify complex integration landscapes. So the very first prerequisite is a BTP account.

1. SAP Ariba applications license : You have a license for one or more of the aforementioned SAP Ariba applications in one of the supported data centers supported by Joule, as Joule is an embedded application that is integrated with SAP products. The currently supported data centers are listed here.

2. SAP BTP : Joule leverages the SAP Business Technology Platform to simplify complex integration landscapes, which makes it the next prerequisite. You should have an enterprise global account on SAP BTP. If you already have a global account in SAP BTP, Joule entitlements can be added in the same global account.

To activate or setup Joule, you need to have the following BTP services.

3. SAP Cloud Identity Services : SAP Cloud Identity Services are a group of services of SAP BTP which enable you to handle provision and integrate identity and access management between systems, providing you a seamless SSO experience across systems with the security. SAP Cloud Identity Services are bundled with an SAP cloud solution, which means you are entitled to one productive and one test tenant preconfigured with the SAP cloud solution (Refer this link). You should have integrated the SAP Ariba application with Identity Authentication as Joule leverages the IAS setup of the SAP product for user login. (Refer this blog for details on SAP Ariba SSO with SAP Cloud Identity Services.)

4. SAP Build Work Zone, Standard Edition : To support navigation to different applications from Joule and handle role based access scenarios, you need to configure the navigation service of SAP Build Work Zone. Joule uses the navigation service component of SAP Build Work Zone, standard edition to resolve intent based navigation targets and configure additional content providers.

5. You have created a subaccount in your global account using the SAP BTP cockpit for provisioning Joule. A single Joule subscription can be integrated into multiple SAP products like SAP SuccessFactors, SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition, or SAP Build Work Zone. However, one subscription of the Joule application can only be integrated with one tenant of an SAP product. This means you cannot include multiple systems of the same product in one Joule formation. You must ensure that there is one IAS tenant per single independent entity and operate every single independent entity from its own dedicated SAP BTP sub-account.

 

LIMITATIONS AS OF Q3 2025 RELEASE

 Buyer Parent-Child MERP (Multi-ERP) realm setup issue in Guided Buying : Joule does not currently support multi-tenant consolidation. To overcome this limitation Customers must run Joule Booster in every child realm. This also means there will be no data consolidation across the realms

entry.title: Common set-up issues of Joule in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition
entry.content: Blog is moved and consolidated here to avoid duplicates: https://community.sap.com/t5/enterprise-resource-planning-blog-posts-by-sap/common-issues-in-sap-joule-activation-in-sap-s-4-hana-private-cloud-edition/ba-p/14125996

entry.title: SAP UX Q3/2025 Update – Part 1: AI, Joule, SAP Build Work Zone, SAP Mobile Start
entry.content:
This series of posts gives an overview of user experience innovations in the cloud from the last six months, covering our whole portfolio, such as AI and Joule, SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2508, SAP SuccessFactors, as well as covering  innovations in our UI technologies for building great UX.

In this first post, we’ll look at the latest cross-suite UX innovations, coming from Joule, SAP Work Zone and SAP Mobile Start.

Here are the links to the other posts in the series published so far:

  • Part 2: SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2508 and SAP Fiori Launchpad (generally available innovations).
  • Part 3: Beta AI Innovations in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2508.
  • Part 4: SAP SuccessFactors (AI, Joule and More).
  • Part 5: SAP Ariba and SAP Fieldglass.

Before we get started: if you haven’t already seen them, do have a look at the overview of public cloud UX innovations I posted in Q1/2025 (parts 2 to 7 are linked in part 1):

  • SAP User Experience Q1/2025 Update – Part 1: Many New Innovations Available (AI, Joule and More).

This upcoming series of posts includes Joule and AI UX highlights from individual products within the SAP Business Suite, but for a more comprehensive overview of our recent AI innovations, not just UX related, have a look at:

  • SAP Business AI: Release Highlights Q2 2025.
  • SAP Sapphire Innovation Guide – SAP Business AI.

 

Joule User Experience Innovations

Joule is the AI-powered copilot for SAP systems, offering a powerful new user experience, using natural language to access our cloud products and providing a seamless flow for the user wherever they are, on desktop, laptop or mobile devices.

First, we’ll have a look at the latest generic or cross-product UX innovations, before I give you some pointers to the product-specific innovations as well as news about developing custom capabilities.

Cross-Product Joule UX Innovations

This section covers these user experience innovations:

  • Joule Analytical Pattern.
  • Joule supports multiple conversations.
  • Use Joule in 11 languages.
  • Joule stand-alone: Joule for Consultants
  • Joule in Microsoft 365 Copilot and Microsoft Teams
  • Joule Agents.

Joule Analytical Pattern

This new pattern is available in all products which give users access to our Joule copilot. This new pattern is powered by SAP Analytics Cloud, with data from models that are indexed by the Just Ask feature of SAP Analytics Cloud.

Figure 1: Example Joule Analytical Pattern. Alt Text: an animated GIF showing how a user asks Joule “Show me sales commission by agend for model bike sales”, and how Joule shows a horizontal bar chart for top 5 sales commissions per sales agent.

As you can see in figure 1, users can now access analytical insights from the product they are working in, without having to first navigate to SAP Analytics Cloud, making work more efficient and hence also more enjoyable.

The example in figure 1 is what we call a descriptive question, but Joule can respond to a wide range of queries:

  • Descriptive questions, such as “What is the total revenue for Q1?” or “Show me sales by region in 2025”.
  • Comparative analysis, such as “Compare sales between 2023 and 2024" Or How do profits in Germany compare to France?”
  • Time series analysis, such as “Show me sales by month” or “Show the trend of customer acquisitions over the last 6 months”.
  • Top / Bottom N analysis, such as “Show me top 5 sales by store” or “List the bottom 3 regions in terms of sales”.

Find out more in this blog post:

  • Introducing Analytical Insights in Joule: Empowering Smarter Decisions, Instantly.

With the introduction of this new pattern, Joule now supports four interaction patterns:

  1. Informational pattern, for querying written documents, such as SAP documentation in the SAP Help Portal, or customer policies etc.
  2. Navigational pattern, for finding and navigating to applications.
  3. Transactional pattern, for interacting directly with business applications.
  4. Analytical pattern, for answering analytical queries directly in Joule.

Joule Supports Multiple Conversations

When having a conversation with Joule, you can ask follow-up questions, building on the previous questions and answers in the conversation, since Joule keeps the context.

Now you can initiate up to ten conversations in parallel, with Joule keeping the context for each of the conversations, so that when you return to a previous conversation you can continue where you left off. Figure 2 shows what this looks like.

 

Figure 2: Joule supports multiple conversations. On the left, a conversation was started by asking “How many languages does Joule support”. On the right, you see how active and expired conversations are shown. Alt Text: On the left, Joule replies with “Joule currently supports eleven language officially” and then lists them, below the answer a link to the source document “Joule Multi Language Support” is provided. On the right, the conversation history sidebar is visible on the left, overlaying half the screen, with a button “+ New Conversation” at the top, followed by a section “Active” with two conversations and a sectin “Expired” with four. The bottom contains a link to “Settings” and on to “AI Notice”.

You can return to conversations within 8 hours. To start a new conversation, simply click on “New Conversation”. The old conversation will be listed in the “Active” section, as you can see in Figure 2. The title of the conversation is automatically created by Joule using AI; users can rename the titles when they return to the conversation.  Joule supports a maximum of 10 active conversations.

After 8 hours, the conversation expires but is not deleted. It is kept read-only in the “Expired” section, as shown in Figure 2. Conversations are finally deleted 7 days after the creation date.

In the browser, Joule can be expanded to fill the screen, as shown in Figure 3.

Figure 3: Joule expanded to full-screen mode, showing the conversation history sidebar and the chat side by side. Alt Text: The same information is shown as on both screens of Figure 2, since the conversation history sidebar does not overlay the chat, and the chat is shown on the right with much more screen width.

Find out more in the documentation:

  • Using the Joule Web Client.

Use Joule in 11 Languages

Figure 3 shows that you can ask Joule which languages it supports, and it will answer with the list of 11 languages. Here they are in alphabetical order, with the variant of the language in brackets.

  • Chinese (Simplified)
  • English (US)
  • French (France)
  • German (Germany)
  • Greek
  • Japanese
  • Korean
  • Polish
  • Portugese (Brazil)
  • Spanish (Spain)
  • Vietnamese

Joule Stand-alone – Joule for Consultants

In addition to providing Joule embedded in our products, we have a design pattern called Joule stand-alone, which we use for Joule for Consultants. With this pattern, Joule can be started directly, without first opening an SAP product and then opening Joule via the icon in the shell header. Joule stand-alone is opened in full screen, as shown in Figure 4.

Figure 4: Joule for Consultants using the Joule stand-alone pattern. Alt-Text: Joule full-screen, with one active conversation “Can you explaine about SAP Clean Core”, followed by a comprehensive answer, and scrolling options for reading the entire text”.

By supporting this pattern, people can open up Joule for Consultants directly and start asking questions about implementing or extending SAP products. Since in this case Joule is stand-alone, as the name suggests, the conversations you have there are not visible in the Joule instance that is embedded in our products, and vice-versa.

Joule in Microsoft 365 Copilot and Microsoft Teams

How often have you been in a chat with a colleague and needed to find some information from an SAP system? Up until now this would involve you leaving the chat, going to a different window and navigating to the right SAP application to get what were looking for.

Now, you can chat directly with Joule in Microsoft Teams, use Joule in Microsoft Teams and Microsoft Teams Mobile as an app, and ask Joule questions directly in Microsoft 365 Copilot. To get an idea of how powerful this is, watch this video:

To get started, have a look at the documentation:

  • Integrating Joule with Microsoft 365 Copilot

Joule Agents

We are bringing SAP Business AI to the next level via Joule Agents, that can autonomously plan and execute multi-step workflows.

Why do I include this in a section on user experience updates? Aren’t Joule Agents a back-end thing? Well… the reason is simple: Joule Agents significantly enhance the overall user experience, as opposed to the user interface, because the system will do a lot more for you based on your requests. This means that the overall experience you have using SAP goes up a level, since you can get a lot done much more easily than before.

Joule Agents can be triggered from Joule directly, or embedded within applications. These four marketing videos show you examples of agents available today:

  • Finance: Dispute Resolution Agent (1:38 minutes)
  • Procurement: Sourcing Agent (1:48 minutes)
  • Sales and services: Account Planning Agent (1:24 minutes)
  • Human Resources: Performance and Goals Agent (1:34 minutes)

This example for customer service agents goes into more detail:

  • CX Agents (in SAP Discovery Center).

For a general overview of Joule Agents, have a look here:

  • Joule Agents on sap.com.
  • AI Agents in Action (blog post).
  • Envision the Future of Generative AI with SAP's AI Agents (blog post).
  • How SAP’s AI Agent Architecture Enables Unprecedented Automation and Decision Augmentation (blog post by Philipp Herzig).

Product-specific capabilities

In addition to the above generic capabilities, our products provide a large number of Joule skills for getting your work done more efficiently, as well as a handful of the new agents discussed above. For a comprehensive overview of Joule capabilities, including product-specific skills available today, here’s where to go:

  • Joule Capabilities (a 484 page (!) PDF document from July 11th, 2025, including a list of What’s New)
  • Joule Capabilities (online documentation)

Customer-specific Joule skills

You can now build your own Joule skills using Joule Studio, which has now been made generally available. Read Michael Ameling’s overview blog post:

  • Joule Studio is generally available in SAP Build: Empower your business with intelligent automation

Joule on Mobile Devices – now for SAP SuccessFactors too

Joule has been available via SAP Mobile Start since Q1/2025 (as announced in this blog post), and is now also available directly from within the SAP SuccessFactors mobile app, supporting these three patterns:

  • Transactional: Joule can handle tasks like requesting time off, updating contact information, and even deleting phone numbers, directly within the chat interface.
  • Navigational: Joule can guide users to specific pages within the app based on their requests, such as directing them to where they can assign team goals.
  • Informational: Joule can access documentation and knowledge bases to answer questions about company policies, HR guidelines, and other relevant information, providing summaries and links to related resources.

Figure 5 shows two examples of the transactional pattern plus one example of the informational pattern (“Can I use my private car for my business trip?”).

 

Figure 5: Examples of Joule on the SuccessFactors Mobile App. Alt Text: The image shows three examples: The first shows the response to the request by a manager “View time off approval”, with the details of one request, including the employee's name, the time-off period, and the type of time-off (vacation). The user can view the details, approve, or decline the request. The second screen shows a conversation where the user asks if they can use their private car for a business trip, and the system responds that they can, providing details on the reimbursement policy. The third screen shows the user requesting one day of vacation leave on March 3, 2025. The system confirms the request and provides the details of the leave, including the start and end times, and the date the user will return to work.

Find out more here:

  • Say Hi to Joule in SAP SuccessFactors Mobile, Powered by SAP Build - Part 1: Unlocking AI for HR)
  • Joule in SAP SuccessFactors Mobile: Getting Things Done with AI...
  • Documentation: Joule Available in SAP SuccessFactors Mobile - May 2025

Further information on Joule

If you want an overview of what’s new, or want to set up Joule in your landscape, have a look at the documentation:

  • Joule documentation (including What’s New, What is Joule?, integration guide)
  • What is Joule? PDF file

For an overview of what is planned, have a look at the road map for Joule in the SAP Road Map Explorer:

  • Joule Road Map.

 

SAP Build Work Zone

SAP Build Work Zone users and administrators benefit from these recent innovations:

  • New Side navigation for SAP Build Work Zone, standard edition.
  • SAPUI5 version preview.
  • Mobile Start supports Work Zone, advanced edition.

New Side Navigation

As I announced in April, in my blog post Upcoming Design Updates for the SAP Business Suite (SAP Fiori for Web), we are introducing some design updates to all our products in the SAP Business Suite to further increase consistency, helping users to feel confident and at ease when using a suite of products – no unexpected surprises. One of these is the introduction of a navigation menu on the left side of the screen.

SAP Build Work Zone, standard edition, is the first product to support this new design. Figure 6 shows what it looks like when the navigation menu is expanded, while Figure 7 shows it collapsed.

Figure 6: Side navigation expanded for SAP Build Work Zone, standard edition. Alt Text: A screen showing a SAP Build Work Zone screen with a navigation menu on the left with four entries “Central Procurement”, “Global Support”, “My IT Experience” (selected), and “Self Services”. On the right various cards are shown in a section “Employee Information”.

 

Figure 7: Side navigation collapsed for SAP Work Zone, standard edition. Alt Text: similar to Figure 6, but with the navigation menu on the left collapsed to the width of an icon, with four icons shown representing the four navigation options.

SAPUI5 Version Preview

We have introduced a new feature that allows administrators to preview upcoming SAPUI5 versions in non-productive environments within SAP Build Work Zone, two weeks before they are adopted in the productive environment.  Until now, the latest SAPUI5 versions were automatically adopted in production environments, which limited opportunities for early evaluation ahead of deployment.

By enabling the preview setting on specific non-productive sites, administrators can assess compatibility and performance with the upcoming version. This controlled testing environment helps identify and address potential issues, reducing the likelihood of disruptions in production. After the two-week preview period, the RTC version becomes the default, aligning all sites with the latest stable release.

When looking at the sites in the site directory, those sites for which the preview is switched on are indicated clearly, as shown in Figure X.

Figure 8: Site directory with a site where preview is turned on. Alt Text: the image shows a card from the site directory for a site called “Preview SAPUI5 Demo” with a green badge containing the text “SAPUI5 Preview Enabled”.

Read more about this feature in this blog post:

  • Introducing SAPUI5 Version Preview in SAP Build Work Zone.

SAP Mobile Start Supports SAP Work Zone, Advanced Edition

When using SAP Mobile Start with SAP Build Work Zone, advanced edition, you can now access your Workspaces or Feed Updates. As with the standard edition, your native and web apps are available within the Apps Screen of SAP Mobile Start, as well as in your Favorites Section on the Start Screen, based on your individual selection. 

Tasks and Notifications from SAP Build Work Zone, advanced edition, are also integrated into SAP Mobile Start: they are shown next to your business tasks and situations in the To-Do sections and in the Notification Center. Figure 9 shows an example with notifications from the advanced edition.

This integration is automatically available to customers with SAP Build Work Zone, advanced edition or SAP SuccessFactors Work Zone if the SAP Mobile Start toggle is enabled in the Site Manager.

Figure 9: SAP Mobile Start notification center with notifications from SAP Build Work Zone, advanced edition. Alt Text: A list of two notifications: “Leave Request”, with a red text “Important” and “2 weeks ago”, and “Invite to Worskpace”, with text “Mustaq Ahmmed has invited you to join the workspace “Help & Support Workspace” and “2 weeks ago”.

 

Note that SAP Mobile Start is not the successor app for the SAP Build Work Zone Advanced mobile app. Find out more here:

  • Support of SAP Build Work Zone, advanced and much more: SAP Mobile Start V2.2 & 2.3 - Release Update.

 

SAP Mobile Start

Updated August 13th with information about the 2.4 release.

Beyond providing Joule natively for mobile devices, SAP Mobile Start has recently introduced a number of user experience improvements with their 2.2 and 2.3 releases. In addition to supporting SAP Build Work Zone, advanced edition, as described above, the main new features are:

  • Completed To-Dos are now displayed too (see Figure 10).
  • Site Switch allows you to directly switch between SAP Build Work Zone sites, without having to go through the onboarding process for each site.
  • The news tile can now also include images (see Figure 10).
  • News feeds that require authentication are supported now.
  • Design updates such as enhanced navigation bar for Apple iPad and a new fresher design for monitoring details on Apple Watch.
  • SAP Document AI integration.
  • Onboarding via deep links.
  • Top news, which gets shown prominently on the start screen.
  • Additional text with sensitive content can now be shown in notifications.

Figure 10: On the left, SAP Mobile Start showing completed To-Dos, on the right showing news with an image. Alt Text: On the left, the To-Dos section is selected, showing two To-Do cards, and the top half of a third card. The first one shows Maria Smith requested 180 days maternity leave, the second one that Quality Manager Donna Moore requested €47,600 spend. The right shows the start page, with a section Monitoring apps at the top, with two cards, followed by the News section, with one card listing two news items, the first of which has an image.

To find out more about the above recent innovations as well as what is planned in our road map, have a look at:

  • Support of SAP Build Work Zone, advanced and much more: SAP Mobile Start V2.2 & 2.3 - Release Update.
  • SAP Mobile Start V2.4: SAP Document AI integration and much more. Release Update.
  • SAP Mobile Start Road Map.

Continue Reading

I hope you enjoyed this first part, covering cross-product UX services. Here's a link to part 2, covering a large number of UX innovations which are generally available with SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2508 and SAP Fiori launchpad:

  • SAP UX Q3/2025 Update – Part 2: SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2508 and SAP Fiori Launchpad.

Do keep posting your experiences and recommendations yourself in the SAP Community, with the SAP Fiori and/or the User Experience tag! In case you are wondering how to get a list of the most recent blog posts on SAP Fiori and User Experience in our new SAP Community, use these links:

  • Latest blog posts on SAP Fiori in the SAP Community.
  • Latest blog posts on User Experience in the SAP Community.

entry.title: Build Shipment Creation and Tracking Skill using Joule Studio integrated with SAP BN4L GTT
entry.content:
As we know by now, Joule is SAP’s generative AI copilot that helps users interact with business data and processes in a conversational, natural language format. With Joule Studio, developers and business users alike can create custom Joule skills to address specific business scenarios, extending the power of SAP Business AI.

With the latest launch of Joule Studio, we can now build custom AI agents and skills that automate workflows and improve efficiency in executing routine tasks. Joule Studio is currently live with the Skill builder and the Agent Builder is slated to be GA later this year. 

Earlier this year, I had the privilege to work with the Joule Studio product teams to build and test Logistics Agents for providing transportation options, fetching weather forecasts on transportation routes and tracking with carriers in real-time.

In this article, we will walk through the steps on how to build Joule Skills for Logistics and Transportation use cases using Joule Studio. These custom skills will help users create a shipment directly in SAP Business Network for Logistics (BN4L) and subsequently track that shipment’s status using Global Track and Trace (GTT) using the Joule digital assistant.

This is particularly useful for transportation planners, customer service reps, and warehouse operators who want a quick and intelligent way to interact with shipment data in natural language - without navigating through multiple systems. Furthermore, once the Joule is activated in S/4HANA systems or SAP Build Workzone then Joule can create shipments directly in BN4L GTT using the data from ERP orders/deliveries. 

Step 1: Prerequisites

Before building the skill in Joule Studio, ensure you have activated the following:

  • Joule Studio on your SAP BTP subaccount. (refer provisioning Joule Studio)

  • SAP Business Network for Logistics tenant with API access. 

  • SAP Business Accelerator Hub to reference GTT APIs. 

  • Authentication credentials for SAP BN4L API endpoints. 

  • Developer role and permissions to create skills in Joule Studio.   

 

Step 2: Design the Skill in Joule Studio

Login to your SAP Build lobby to create a Joule Skill. 

Skill to Create Shipment in BN4L GTT

Step 1: Create a new Joule skill and provide a valid description which will help as the trigger mechanism. Add input parameters to the skills to capture Source Location, Destination Location, Pickup Date, Shipment No, etc. 

We can even make this optimizer this step further by fetching an ERP delivery data from a S/4HANA System using the Odata Service. With that Joule will be able to fetch the delivery details to create a shipment. However, to understand how the conversations work, we can proceed with capturing data from the user.  

Step 2: Create and Publish a Build Action from Build Lobby to integrate your BN4L GTT tenant with SAP Build. 
Here, we can use the GTT Write Service API (Shipment Event) which creates a shipment in GTT (For more info visit SAP Help)

Step 3: Add the published Action to Joule Skill and map the Skill input to Action input. 

Step 4 (Optional): Add Send Message function to display a successful shipment creation message to the User along with a hyperlink to navigate GTT shipment to v. 

Step 5: Deploy and Test the Joule Skill using the Build Environments. Currently, Joule Studio supports testing the custom Joule Skills only from within an Environment. Under Joule, launch the standalone Joule Digital Assistant. 

 

Step 3: Joule digital assistant (the conversation part) 

Use Joule digital assistant to test the skill that we just deployed. Open the logs to review the steps performed by Joule to execute a Skill based on user input. 

Create a shipment conversation with basic shipment information. 

 

Skill to Track Shipment using BN4L GTT

Step 1:  Return to SAP Build Lobby and open your project, within the project create a new Joule Skill. Remember to add a wholesome description. Add input - trackingId and output parameters -status, city, region. 

Step 2: Add a new Build Action to fetch shipment status from GTT. To find more details of the GTT Read services in the BN4L GTT Reference Guide.

Release and Publish the Action to be used in Joule Skill. 

Refer to the SAP BPA help to learn more on how to use $filter capability while querying using an Odata service. 

Step 3: Add this Action as a step function in the Track Shipment Joule Skill. Map the Action input to the Skills Input to pass the tracking number from the user as a query parameter to the GTT read service. This will improve the overall performance and response time of Joule during runtime conversations. 

Create a new destination variable to represent the GET service BTP destination. 

Step 4: In the End step, map the Skills Output to the corresponding fields from the Action Output result. This will enable Joule to form a logical output based on the message to be displayed to the user.  

Step 5:  Release and deploy the skill to the same Environment created for the first skill. 

Step 6: Navigate to the Environment, now you should be able to see the latest version of the Project deployed. Launch the Joule DA from the Joule tab. 

Step 3: Joule digital assistant (the conversation part) 

Track the shipment with Shipment ID to view the execution status and the current location. 

Step 4: Integrate Joule with SAP Build Workzone

Enable your users to interact with Joule and enjoy these custom skills by activating Joule in SAP Build Workzone.  

Final Thoughts

This is an high level overview on building custom Joule Skills for deterministic tasks based on business processes expanding the horizon of SAP Business AI. With Joule Studio, we are now able to extend SAP Joule's AI capabilities to address unique business needs. 

Learn more about how SAP Premium Engagement can help you accelerate your digital transformation with curated AI workshops and discovery sessions. 

SAP Business AI Joule SAP Business Network for Logistics SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition @SAPMaxAttention

entry.title: Joule Studioがリリースされたので早速CAPアプリを自然言語で操作するカスタムスキルを構築してみた
entry.content:
はじめに

先日、SAP Buildに新たに Joule Studio が加わりました。これは、自然言語によってエンドユーザーの業務操作を支援する「Joule 」のカスタムスキルをノーコードベースで開発できるサービスです。このJoule Studioではカスタムスキルとカスタムエージェントの構築ができる予定ですが、現段階でリリースされている機能はカスタムスキルの構築のみです。

本記事では、SAP BTPで提供される開発フレームワークである CAP（Cloud Application Programming Model） で構築した書籍管理アプリケーションをベースに、Joule Studioを用いて「書籍IDから情報を取得するカスタムスキル」を構築するプロセスをご紹介します。

ゴールは下記のような形です。

  • ユーザーがJouleに「201番の本の詳細を教えて」と話しかけると、CAPアプリのODataエンドポイントから該当データを取得し、回答できるようにすること。

 

ステップ①：CAPアプリケーションの準備

プロジェクト作成とサンプル追加

まずは SAP Build Code にて、Full-Stack Cloud Applicationプロジェクトを作成します。

ターミナルを起動したのち、下記コマンドにより、Bookshopサンプル（Books, Authors, Genresなど）をプロジェクトに追加します。

cds add sample

これにより、BookShopアプリケーションで利用するデータモデルやロジック、サンプルデータなどがプロジェクトの中に追加されます。

MTA構成の有効化とサービス定義確認



次に、SAP BTP環境にデプロイを行うために、下記のコマンドを実行します。

cds add mta

これにより Multi Target Application（MTA）構成を追加することができます。ファイルとしては、mta.yamlなどが追加されます。

このアプリケーションのCatalogServiceとAdminServiceの定義を確認してみましょう。CatalogServiceではBookなどに関するデータの閲覧ができたり、注文発注の関数が定義されていたり、という構成が確認できます。

一方、AdminServiceの側にはロール制御（@requires: 'admin'）が設定されています。これにより、BooksやAuthorsのデータモデルの編集処理はadminというロールを持ったユーザーのみが行えるように構成されています。

セキュリティとモックデータの準備

そして、そのロールは xs-security.json というファイルに定義されています。下記のコマンドを実行することで、Role TemplateがService定義に基づいて追加され、アプリケーションをデプロイした際に同時にロールが定義されてSAP BTP Cockpitから操作できるようになります。

cds compile srv/ --to xsuaa > xs-security.json

また、dataディレクトリの中にはモックデータも追加されています。このデータは、デプロイ時には SAP HANA Cloud へ自動的に初期データとして追加されます。

デプロイ前に、一度プレビューしてみましょう。cds watch というコマンドでプレビューサーバーを立ち上げることができます。

/odata/v4/catalog/Books

上記のODataエンドポイントにアクセスすると、データが返ってくることが確認できます。

問題なければ、ビルドを行いましょう。下記のコマンドで .mtar ファイルを作成します。

mbt build

 

ステップ②：SAP BTP環境へのデプロイと設定

アプリケーションのデプロイと確認

作成された .mtar ファイル を右クリックし、Deploy MTA Application ボタンをクリックします。

無事に Cloud Foundry環境にデプロイが完了すると、アプリケーションが正常に起動していることをSAP BTP Cockpit上で確認することができます。

XSUAAロールとDestinationの構成

同じく、アプリケーションのRoleタブを開くとデプロイされたロールも確認可能です。

定義済みのadminロールをカスタムで作成したロールコレクションに割り当て、権限を必要とする対象ユーザーに付与しておきましょう。ただし、今回は簡単な検証をするだけなのでこのロールベースアクセスは扱いません。

それでは次に、JouleのカスタムスキルからCAPにアクセスさせる際のDestinationを定義します。作成にあたり、CAPのアクセスに必要な認証情報（サービスキー）を作成します。

これに基づき、下記の通り OAuth2 Client Credentials方式でDestinationを構成します。
下記の通り、間違えのないように記載してください。

項目

値

URL

デプロイしたアプリケーションのURL + /odata/v4/catalog

Authentication

OAuth2ClientCredentials

Client ID

サービスキーのuaa.clientId

Client Secret

サービスキーのuaa.clientSecret

TokenService URL

サービスキーのuaa.url + /oauth/token

下記のプロパティも忘れずに設定するようにしてください。

プロパティ名

値

sap.processautomation.enabled

true

sap.applicationdevelopment.actions.enabled

true

sap.build.usage

CAP

それでは、ここからは SAP Build の設定に入ってきます。SAP Build側にもSAP BTP Cockpit 側で定義したDestinationをインポートし、API接続の準備を整えていきます。



ステップ③：CAP APIをJouleアクションとして公開

Actionの定義とデプロイ

それではJoule Studioで構築するカスタムスキル内で外部APIへの接続時に利用するActionを作成していきます。

アクション作成画面に入ると、CAPアプリケーションを選択します。その後、先ほど登録したCAPアプリのODataエンドポイント（BookShopSample_CatalogAPI）を選択します。これにより、CAPのODataのメタデータを自動的に読み取り、そのAPIに用意されたエンドポイントを自動で読み取ることができます。

必要なアクションを選択し、テスト → リリース → パブリッシュまでを行います。今回はBooksエンティティなどのアクションを選択しています。今回のブログの範囲では、この中でもBooksをIDに基づいて取得するアクションを使っていきます。

 

ここまでは今まで SAP Build からアクションを使って外部APIを呼び出す際には同じようにやっていたことですね。さて、ここからが新しくリリースされた部分になります！

 

ステップ④：Joule Skills の作成

スキルプロジェクトの作成と設定

「BookShopSample_Skills」というスキルプロジェクトを作成し、まずは getBookFromBookShopByID スキルを作成します。
（画像ではlistBooksスキルを作っていますが、よしなにスキルを作成してみてください）

他にも色々な形のスキルを追加してみてください。それぞれのスキルについて、デプロイ前に何かしらの処理が定義されていなければならないため、ミニマムでお試しされる方は getBookFromBookShopByID のみ定義すればOKです。

ステップ⑤：スキルの内部構成（Get Book by ID）

スキルにActionを組み込む

前ステップで公開したアクションプロジェクトから「Get entity from Books by key」アクションをスキル内に追加します。

BookID入力の受け取りと変換

次に、このアクションは本のIDを引数として要求するので、Joule Skillの入力引数を定義し、それをアクションに渡す設定を行います。この際に、現段階の仕様ではスキルの入力引数はText型に固定されているようなため、Formulaを用いて、アクションが受け付けるNumber型に変更する必要があります。

ユーザーへの応答構成

次に、ユーザーへ表示するコンポーネントを構成します。Send Message コンポーネントを追加し、アクションからの返り値を渡していきます。具体的には、取得した書籍データ（タイトル・価格・在庫）を「イラスト付きメッセージ」で視覚的に表示します。

 

ステップ⑥：スキルのデプロイとJouleからの呼び出し

お疲れさまでした、これで設定は完了です！それでは早速、このスキルをデプロイしていきましょう。

環境へのデプロイとDestinationマッピング

作成したスキルを任意のSAP Build Process Automationの環境（例：PlayGround1）にデプロイし、Destinationとの関連付けを行います。この際、サンセットが予定されているPublic環境はデプロイ先として指定できません。必ず新規に作成したShared環境を使うようにしてください。

なお、環境の詳細な情報や作成方法は下記SAP Help Portalをご参照ください。

https://help.sap.com/docs/build-process-automation/sap-build-process-automation/environments?locale=ja-JP

動作検証（英語・日本語）

それでは、デプロイされたスキルを呼び出していきましょう。Joule Studioでは、カスタムスキルを検証するためのJouleが分離された形で用意されています。このJouleには、下記の通りアクセスすることが可能です。

Launch ボタンをクリックすると、全画面でJouleが表示されます。早速聞いてみましょう。

Joule に対して自然言語で 201番の本の詳細を教えて、などの内容を入力すると、正しく応答が返ってくることを確認できました。今回はIDからの詳細取得のみを実装していますが、同様にスキル定義を追加していくことで、様々な角度から詳細を取得していくことができるようになるはずです。

例えば、Send Message モジュールにも色々な形があり、例えばリストを扱うようなlistBooksを実装すると下記のようになります。

是非他にも色々と触ってみていただければと思います！

おわりに

今回の構成では、CAP で構築した OData API を SAP Build および Joule Studio と統合し、ユーザーが自然言語で業務処理を実行できる仕組みをノーコードで構築することができました。

今後は今回作成した「取得系」のスキルに加えて、「登録」「更新」「集計」などの対話型業務オペレーションを拡張していくことで、より実践的な業務アシスタントを構築できると考えられます。まだまだリリースされたばかりの機能ですが、今後の機能拡張に是非ご期待ください！

entry.title: Try the latest AI features in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2508
entry.content:
The 2508 release of SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition contains enhancements to popular AI features and new natural language interaction options that help you work more intelligently and intuitively.

We’ve spent the past 6 months since the 2502 release working with your feedback – from beta programs, to roundtable discussions in the Public Cloud Practitioner Forum, to one-on-one meetings with customers – to learn how we can help you achieve more with the help of AI in your system. Let’s take a look at what’s new, update you on the commercialization of some features, and give you resources for getting involved with our upcoming beta program. 

Natural language filtering now supports a wider range of queries

The AI-assisted easy filter (first released in 2502) enables you to filter list reports in your SAP Fiori elements-based apps using natural language. This simplifies how you access the information you need and reduces the training time required to pick up new applications delivered by SAP.

AI-assisted easy filter enables natural language filtering of pages with lists of business objects. Here the user can filter for a given sold-to party using plain language rather than needing to know its key..

For 2508, we’ve made a number of enhancements to make interactions with AI-assisted easy filter even more intuitive:

  1. Tables can be filtered without needing to know an object’s specific key. Instead, simply enter the name of the object you are looking for. The AI-assisted easy filter will map that text to the intended key and apply it to the filter fields for you, which is a much more natural way to search for information. In the event that there are multiple keys with similar names, you will receive results filtered for those names. As before, you can always refine your results in the input field or using the classic filtering.
  2. We’ve also worked to ensure parity between the filter fields that can be applied using the AI-assisted easy filter and the classic filter bar. Some users had reported that, in some cases, AI-assisted easy filter would not apply queries to certain filters. This was caused by the fact that some of the filter fields used navigation paths to different entities instead of the main entity for the app. This scenario is now supported and you can filter on any property present in the classic filter bar.

My Home Personalization with Insights Cards supports more apps and a new way to query for cards

The ability to create Insights cards and quickly add them to My Home now supports 20 SAP Fiori apps.

AI-assisted smart personalization of My Home for Insights cards was released as a Joule capability as part of its 2503 release. The functionality allows end users to query Joule for business data they regularly need using natural language. The output is displayed as a card that can be added to their My Home page for easy reference. This makes it easier for users to access information they need to make everyday business decisions and move processes forward.

This functionality was initially limited to 9 applications. With the 2508 release of SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition, this coverage has been extended to 11 additional applications. This gives users easier and wider access to the business data that is important to them. AI-assisted smart personalization of My Home for Insights cards now supports the following applications:

  1. Find Maintenance Order
  2. Find Maintenance Order and Operation
  3. Maintain Bill Of Material
  4. Manage Business Partner Master Data
  5. Manage Customer Returns
  6. Manage Manual Reservations
  7. Manage Material Coverage (Version 2)
  8. Manage Outbound Deliveries
  9. Manage Product Master Data
  10. Manage Purchase Orders (Version 2)
  11. Manage Purchase Requisitions - Professional
  12. Manage Sales Orders
  13. Manage Sales Orders - Version 2
  14. Manage Sales Quotation - Version 2
  15. Manage Supplier Master Data
  16. Manage Usage Decisions
  17. Material Documents Overview
  18. Project Control - Enterprise Projects
  19. Reproceess Failed Material Movements
  20. Supplier Invoices List (Version 2)

Users can now use natural language to create and add Insights Cards directly in My Home.

For the 2508 release, we have also introduced a new way to create Insights cards using natural language: you can access the feature directly from My Home. This gives users the flexibility to choose the personalization option that works best for them, giving them access to the information they need at a glance.

If you'd like to read even more exciting updates about features and functionality included in the 2508 release of SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition, check out the following fantastic blogs from my colleagues:

  • For a general overview of new functionality: Highlights of the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2508 release 
  • For a few more AI uses cases, some focused on particular business processes: Exploring AI and next-gen Cloud ERP innovations in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2508 

Commercialization update: New Base AI includes common AI functions at no additional cost

For the 2508 release of SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition, a number of AI solutions have been added to its Base AI offering. This means that you can use the features absolutely free of charge. You simply need to sign the SAP AI terms here and SAP will handle the activation for you.

Included in the Base AI offering for this release are AI-assisted easy filter and AI-assisted smart summarization, as well as AI-assisted enterprise search (which allows you to look up data from the search in My Home). Give them a try!

Try out upcoming AI innovations in the 2508 beta

For customers looking to try out the absolute latest in AI innovations, registration for the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition beta is still open. This is your opportunity to try out and give feedback on new use cases for AI in your system. The solutions up for beta testing are free to use for the duration of the program.  Below is a preview of some of the features that will be available. Please note: Customer/partner participation will be at the discretion of the Beta Testing Program team. Participants must use SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition productively. Future developments are at the discretion of SAP and their details and delivery dates may be changed at any time.

Resolve situations directly in My Home without navigating to applications

AI-assisted smart solution for situations in My Home allows you to quickly take action on business processes that need your attention directly in My Home..

The Situations tab in My Home provides quick summaries of business processes that need to be addressed in your system. Previously, this meant reading the alert on the tile, navigating to the required app(s), and making the required changes. With AI-assisted Smart Solution for Situations in My Home, we’re streamlining how you take action on these scenarios. You’ll now be able to see a summary of the situation, start the relevant business process from quick actions on the card, and even make changes to the business data all without leaving your My Home page. This allows you to stay on top of your business and resolve potential issues even faster.

Streamline data entry in object pages

AI-assisted easy fill streamlines data entry by populating object pages based on natural language input (for example: emails or messages from colleagues).

Depending on your business scenario, SAP Fiori object pages can sometimes be quite complex. Data entry might mean filling a field at the top of the screen, scrolling for several sections to add more information, and so on. AI-assisted easy fill enables you to enter your updates into a single field using natural language. The solution then maps your input to the proper fields, highlights any potential inconsistencies that may need to be addressed, and – after your review – updates the fields. This will help speed up data entry and reduce training time for new users.

Resolve error messages with AI assistance

AI-assisted error explanation provides resolution recommendations to error and warning messages in your system.

Learning new business processes can be tricky. AI-assisted error explanation uses AI to generate explanations and suggest resolutions for errors that are triggered in your system. This streamlines how you handle errors and reduces training time, making you more productive and helping you pick up processes even faster; in addition to reducing your organization’s support load.

Search for applications you need using natural language

AI-assisted smart personalization of My Home for applications allows you to search for applications using natural language.

When learning a new business process or stepping into a new role, it can sometimes be challenging to find the exact application you need to carry out a task. With AI-assisted smart personalization of My Home for applications, you can search for the app you need using natural language. Simply type in what you need to do and get served the required application, which you can add to your My Home page with a single click. This allows you to access the applications you need without needing to know the exact application name.

We want to hear from you!

Whether you take advantage of the new free features in the Base AI package, subscribe to cutting edge technologies, or choose to take part in a beta program; we want to hear what you think about these solutions!
