Give them a try and share your feedback below or with the product team. Your experience is critical to understanding how we can make these innovations even better for you.

When you’re ready to get involved, you can:

  1. Register to use base AI features
  2. Sign up for the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition beta
  3. Join the Public Cloud Practitioner Forum (for customers live on SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition)

Happy experimenting! We’ll be back with another update for the 2602 release of SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition.

entry.title: Leveraging SAP Joule for Performance & Goals Management: Exact Prompts for Maximum Productivity
entry.content:
SAP Joule, the generative AI assistant built into SAP SuccessFactors, is transforming how organizations manage Performance & Goals (PMGM) activities. With Joule’s natural language interface, managers and employees can interact directly with their performance data. Driving speed, accuracy, and engagement. Here’s how you can make the most of Joule, with concrete prompts you can use right away.

 

1. What Can Joule Do for PMGM?

Joule bridges the gap between traditional HR processes and user-friendly digital experiences, empowering you to:

  • Access and update goals

  • Navigate and complete performance reviews

  • Give and receive feedback in real time

  • Manage team calibration, analytics, and more

2. Try These Exact Prompts With Joule

Below are ready-to-use prompts you can enter right into Joule to access, update, or analyze PMGM data:

Goal Management

  • “Show me all my current performance goals.”

  • “Update the status of my goal ‘Increase Q3 Sales’ to 80% complete.”

  • “Add a comment to my goal ‘Improve customer satisfaction’: ‘Completed training on new CRM.’”

  • “List my team’s goals for this quarter.”

  • “Help me cascade my goal ‘Launch New Product’ to my direct reports.”

Performance Reviews & 360 Feedback

  • “Open my performance review form.”

  • “What is the status of my 360 review?”

  • “Show me feedback I’ve received in my performance review.”

  • “Who on my team hasn’t submitted their performance reviews yet?”

Continuous Performance Activities

  • “Create a new activity: ‘Completed lead generation workshop.’”

  • “Add an achievement for ‘Closed major client deal’ to my performance record.”

  • “View all feedback I’ve given this year.”

  • “Request feedback from John Smith on my collaboration skills.”

Team Management & Calibration

  • “Show me my team’s performance ratings distribution.”

  • “List employees in my team who are ready for promotion.”

  • “Start a talent calibration session for my department.”

  • “Generate a summary report of my team’s goals progress.”

Analytics & Insights

  • “Show me a dashboard of team goal completion rates.”

  • “What percentage of my team met their goals last cycle?”

  • “Give me insights on performance trends over the past year.”

Other Practical Prompts

  • “Remind me to submit my self-appraisal by Friday.”

  • “Explain the 9-box grid to me.”

  • “Help me find the company’s goal library.”

  • “How do I assign a new goal to my direct report?”

3. Best Practices to Drive Value

  • Encourage managers and employees to experiment with these prompts for day-to-day PMGM tasks.

  • Incorporate common prompts in onboarding or training materials to boost adoption.

  • Use prompts to keep review cycles on track with reminders and reporting.

  • Harness dashboard and analytics prompts for sharper, data-driven decisions.

4. The Big Payoff

Using SAP Joule with the right prompts brings:

  • Immediate access to the right performance data and actions

  • Consistency and transparency in performance management

  • Engaged, self-sufficient managers and employees

  • More productive, agile, and collaborative talent processes

Try out these prompts in Joule today and unlock a new era of intelligent, conversational performance management in your organization!

entry.title: Unlocking On-Premise Data for SAP Joule Studio with SAP BTP Destinations
entry.content:
1 – Why this matters

Since July 2025, Joule Studio has supported SAP BTP Destination service as a first-class data source. In practice, that means you can point the copilot to any on-premise or partner API that is exposed through a Destination, without replicating data to the cloud. Joule then consumes the data securely at runtime, treats it just like a native Skill, and returns answers in natural language. 
https://architecture.learning.sap.com/docs/ref-arch/06ff6062dc

For the many customers who still run SAP ECC, S/4HANA On-Premise, or tightly-regulated third-party systems, this closes the one remaining gap: Joule’s AI smarts are now reachable before a full RISE-with-SAP migration. You still need a Joule client, from SAP Build WorkZone, for example.

 

2 – How the plumbing works

  1. Set up SAP Cloud Connector

    Create an outbound tunnel from your DMZ to the BTP subaccount and whitelist the internal host and port. No inbound firewall holes are necessary.

  2. Define a Destination

    In BTP, configure a Destination with ProxyType = OnPremise that points to the internal OData, REST or RFC endpoint. Add OAuth2 SAML-Bearer, Basic, or principal propagation as required.

  3. Import in Joule Studio

    In the new “Data Services” tab, choose Import from Destination. Joule Studio inspects the OpenAPI spec or $metadata document and generates an Action (Skill) interface automatically.

Run the chat

At runtime, Joule resolves the Destination, routes the call through Cloud Connector, and grounds the LLM’s answer on live on-prem data. Authorizations remain intact because Joule forwards the user’s JWT or system credentials.

Note: You still need to wrap legacy RFC/BAPI calls in OData V2, CAP or RAP facades so that Destinations can expose them cleanly.

 

3 – Three concrete scenarios for FR & BE customers

Scenario 1 – Luxury retailer in France (ECC6 + BW on HANA)

A store manager types: “Stock du sac ‘Montpellier’ au Printemps Haussmann ?” Joule calls BAPI_MATERIAL_STOCK_REQ_LIST through the Destination and replies in French within seconds, eliminating phone calls and SAP GUI look-ups during peak tourist season.

Scenario 2 – Belgian discrete manufacturer (S/4HANA OP 2021 FPS02)

An engineer asks: “Montre-moi les cinq derniers résultats QC pour le lot 450123.” Joule fetches data from the QA32 OData service, surfaces inspection characteristics and links to the certificate of analysis PDF, cutting lead time on corrective actions required by EU MDR regulations.

Scenario 3 – Cross-border energy utility (FR/BE) with third-party DMS + ECC

A field technician on an ATEX-rated iPad says: “Quelle est la procédure de purge pour la vanne 14-BE-125 ?” Joule simultaneously queries a Documentum REST API for technical drawings and the ECC equipment master via two Destinations, providing hands-free access and reducing pipeline downtime.

 

 

4 – Getting started

  1. Upgrade your Joule Studio tenant to the July 2025 feature bundle (or later).

  2. Patch Cloud Connector 2.17 or newer to enable JWT forwarding.

  3. Model an on-prem API façade (CAP, RAP, SAP Gateway) and expose a $metadata endpoint.

  4. Create design-time and runtime Destinations, setting WebIDEEnabled = true.
    https://help.sap.com/docs/Joule_Studio/45f9d2b8914b4f0ba731570ff9a85313/190b6dd5c820465f98f4e7f85977b16e.html

  5. Import, test and publish the new Skill inside Joule Studio.

  6. Roll out to pilot users, collect unanswered questions and refine the Skill.

     

5 – Why this is a big deal

  • It bridges the last mile for hybrid landscapes: on-prem data stays on-prem, yet Joule can reach it securely.

  • It eases cloud adoption: start with one high-impact use case, prove value, and migrate workloads at your own pace.

  • It reduces change management: users keep one chat UI while the back-end location is abstracted away.

  • It is future-proof: the same Destination can later point to your RISE system with minimal refactoring.

Yes, some development effort is still required (especially to wrap legacy BAPIs and secure tokens) but the payoff in faster decisions and higher user satisfaction is already evident among early adopters.

Happy building, and let Joule talk to all your data! 🚀

entry.title: Kicking Off LangGraph Agents 🦜 🔗 from SAP Joule Studio 💎 💻
entry.content:
1 – Why this matters 💪

Until now, Joule conversations were mostly synchronous: the copilot fetched data, reasoned, and replied in one go. But many business processes need long-running, multi-step logic (think document routing, complex approvals, or data harmonisation) that should continue well after the user closes the chat.

Thanks to the July 2025 Joule Studio update, a Skill can now hit any HTTP endpoint configured as a Destination. If that endpoint points to a Flask app wrapping a LangGraph agent, Joule can fire off the request and immediately return control to the user. The LangGraph agent then runs independently, using:

  • SAP BTP AI Core for scalable LLM calls or fine-tuned models

  • SAP Integration Suite for robust connectivity to SAP and non-SAP back ends

  • Whatever graph logic you design: retries, memory, parallel tools, you name it

The result is a loosely coupled pattern: Joule handles the conversational UX; LangGraph handles the orchestration; BTP services supply compute and integrations.

 

2 – How the plumbing works 🔗

  1. Package your LangGraph agent as a Flask server

    Inside the POST /invoke handler, accept JSON from Joule, run the graph, and return 202 Accepted. Optionally persist a  correlation ID.

  2. Deploy to SAP BTP (Kyma / Cloud Foundry)

    Expose the route only internally.

  3. Create a Destination

    In your BTP sub-account set ProxyType = Internet (Kyma) or OnPremise (Cloud Connector) and enable WebIDEEnabled.

  4. Add a Joule Skill

    In Joule Studio ➔ Data Services, import the OpenAPI spec (or point to the /openapi.json of your Flask app) and map inputs/outputs.

  5. Call it from chat

    When the user says “Launch quarterly risk analysis”, Joule issues a POST, gets a 202, and replies: “Sure, I’ve launched the analysis. I’ll notify you when it’s done.”

 

3 – What this unlocks in France or Belgium 💼

Automated PDF contract review for a Belgian insurer

User: « Analyse ce contrat RC Auto et signale les clauses à risque »

Flow: Joule uploads the PDF ➔ triggers LangGraph ➔ agent calls AI Core for document parsing and legal-clause LLM prompts ➔ Integration Suite writes findings back to S/4HANA CM. A Teams message notifies the underwriter when the report is ready.

Regulatory e-invoicing enrichment for French retailers

User: « Prépare la facture X-France pour Carrefour »

Flow: Joule fires a LangGraph agent that enriches raw FI data with mandatory e-invoicing fields, queries external tax APIs, validates against Chorus Pro requirements, and pushes the XML to Integration Suite for submission. All without blocking the chat.

Smart maintenance work-package builder for a Benelux chemical plant

User: « Planifie la révision du compresseur C-450 »

Flow: Joule triggers a LangGraph graph that checks equipment history, predicts spare-part demand via an ML model in AI Core, reserves materials in S/4HANA, schedules technicians in Field Service Management, and emails a consolidated work order PDF.

 

4 – Getting started in your landscape ✅

  1. Clone the LangGraph Flask boilerplate (SAP Sample GitHub repo).

git clone https://github.com/langchain-ai/new-langgraph-project my_agent
cd my_agent && pip install -e .

 

This gives you the default folder layout with src/agent/graph.py.

  • Add your graph logic

    Implement the state machine, tools, and memory inside src/agent/graph.py exactly as you would for any LangGraph project.

  • Wrap it in a Flask service

    Create an app.py at the project root:

from flask import Flask, request
from src.agent.graph import app as graph  # compiled LangGraph app

flask_app = Flask(__name__)

@flask_app.post("/invoke")
def invoke():
    payload = request.get_json(force=True)
    run_id = graph.invoke_async(payload)  # non-blocking
    return ("", 202, {"X-Run-ID": run_id})​

      4. Tell LangGraph to use Flask

      Edit langgraph.json:

{
  "graphs": { "agent": "./src/agent/graph.py:graph" },
  "http":   { "app": "./app.py:flask_app" }
}

  1. Containerize and push to SAP BTP

    • Cloud Foundry: cf push my-agent

    • Kyma: build an OCI image and kubectl apply -f deployment.yaml

     

  2. Create a Destination

    In your BTP sub-account, set Type = HTTP, choose OAuth2 Client Credentials (or principal propagation through Cloud Connector), and point the URL to /invoke.

  3. Import the endpoint as a Joule Skill

    In Joule Studio → Data Services → Import from Destination, load the OpenAPI spec or manually define the POST request.

  4. Chat, trigger and iterate

    Ask Joule: “Lance l’analyse de risque trimestrielle.” Joule calls the /invoke route, gets a 202 response, and immediately tells the user the job has started. Use notifications (Teams, e-mail, SAP Mobile Start) to report completion.

You now have a fully decoupled “fire-and-forget” pattern: Joule for conversation, LangGraph for orchestration, AI Core for heavy LLM calls, and Integration Suite for back-end connectivity, all glued together by a single Destination.

 

5 – Why this is a big deal 🎯

  • Decouple UX from heavy workflows - users get instant confirmation; complex logic runs in the background.

  • Reuse BTP services you already own - AI Core, Integration Suite, Event Mesh, CAP apps.

  • Lean path to innovation for hybrid customers - no need to upgrade core ERP before piloting AI-powered assistants.

  • Future-proof architecture - swap the Flask server with any containerized runtime; switch models in AI Core; extend graphs without touching Joule.

 

Early pilots show cycle-time reductions of 40 % on multi-step tasks, with minimal change management, because users just chat!

Ready to let Joule pull LangGraph’s trigger?
Your first “fire-and-forget” Skill is only a Flask endpoint away. 🚀

entry.title: SAP UX Q3/2025 Update – Part 4: SAP SuccessFactors (AI, Joule and More)
entry.content:
This fourth post in my series gives an overview of user experience innovations in SAP SuccessFactors. It covers Joule and many AI-based UX innovations along with enhanced user experiences. By following the career of Jon, who starts by applying for a job and then grows within the company, you can see how our latest user experience innovations help business users (employees and managers), work more effectively.

Before reading this, do read the first blog post introducing the series and providing general information about Joule and central entry points and services, along with links to all the published parts of this blog post series:

  • SAP UX Q3/2025 Update – Part 1: AI, Joule, SAP Build Work Zone, SAP Mobile Start.

Also, if you missed it, do have a look at the many UX innovations which already came out end of last year with the SAP SuccessFactors 2H2024 release:

  • SAP User Experience Q1/2025 Update – Part 3: SAP SuccessFactors (AI, Joule and More).

The 1H2025 release comes with a large number of UX innovations across the whole portfolio. In the following sections, I’ll summarize the main highlights by following the career of Jon, and showing how the new AI-powered UX innovations help:

  • Jon find the right job with the help of the new guided application experience.
  • Managers move through the hiring process more efficiently, rating skills and competencies of candidates with Joule, and getting AI-assisted interview insights.
  • Jon understand the main features available to him in his employee HR applications.
  • Jon get an easy-to-understand overview of his benefits and payroll.
  • Jon use natural language with Joule to get questions answered and detailed information about pay statements, not only from at his desk but also via mobile phone.
  • Jon learn more, with learning overview and skilled-based learning recommendations.
  • Jon and his manager to manage goals and performance reviews, with AI-insights making his manager’s job a lot easier.

One more innovation is the new alumni experience, for departing and departed employees, helping them to

  • Manage personal information and access important documents during and after the off-boarding process.

To get the complete picture of all the new SuccessFactors innovations, have a look at the links in the “Further Information “ section towards the end of this post.

 

Find the Right Job With New Guided Application Experience

Jon is applying for a job at a company which uses SAP SuccessFactors Recruiting, and finds the whole process very intuitive, thanks to the new guided application experience, as well as the further enhancements in the reimagined candidate experience.

Figure 1 shows the new guided application experience. This attractive UI guides applicants through the required steps, with AI-assistance provided along the way. For example, Figure 1 shows the AI button “Suggest Skills”, which can help candidates when listing their own skills by indicating other skills which they may also have but did not consider mentioning.

Figure 1: Guided job application experience with SAP SuccessFactors Recruiting. Alt Text: A screenshot of a six-step guided activity, with the six steps running horizontally across the top of the screen: “Getting Started”, “Profile”, “Skills Information”, “Employment”, “Education”, “Review”. The screen shows “Skills Information”, with ten skills already selected, a search field for adding a skill and an AI “Suggest Skills” button.

Once Jon has gone through the guided steps, he can use the updated and refreshed applications dashboard that gives an overview of his applications with easy access to post-application steps, and to completed and in-progress applications. If Jon wants to review his candidate profile and make adjustments, this is also easier now with the refreshed candidate profile. See examples of these, and more, here:

  • Blog post: 1H 2025: Explore the Reimagined Candidate Experience and New AI-Assisted Capabilities in Recruiting.
  • Documentation: The Reimagined Candidate Experience.

 

Joule and AI-Assisted Interview Insights Help Managers Recruit

Providing Interview Feedback with Joule

Once the interview has taken place, each interviewer needs to summarize their feedback on the candidates, such as Jon. This can now be done easily using Joule and natural language, where you can say who you want to give feedback for and assing the ratings all in one go, as you can see in Figure 2.

Figure 2: Providing interview feedback with Joule. Alt Text: An image of Joule showing a chat, with the first entry by the user being “Mike Wang”, followed by a text asking the user to provide feedback for him, explaining the scale 1 to 5 and providing a text for copying into the chat listing the five areas to rate, and a line for overall comment and one for recommendation. The user has copied the text into their response and added the ratings, comment and recommendation (“yes”). 

AI-Assisted Interview Insights

When multiple interviewers are involved, the recruiting manager needs to consolidate the feedback from all of them, based on their ratings of competencies as well as individual remarks. This is where the AI-assisted interview insights comes in handy: by clicking on the AI “generate” button, the manager gets a natural language summary of the interviewer’s feedback on the candidate Jon. This is provided in sections Overview, Strengths, Concerns, Interviewer’s Overall Feedback, with a separate section Data Referenced that provides an overview of the inputs used to create the AI-assisted insights. Figure 3 shows an example, and Figure 4 shows it in action.

Not only does this help the manager save time and be more efficient, it also helps her be more effective: the feedback across multiple candidates is consolidated consistently, ensuring that all aspects of a candidate’s interview feedback are consolidated and uniformly presented. Furthermore, key insights are highlighted.

Figure 3: AI-assisted interview insights with SAP SuccessFactors Recruiting. Alt Text: A screenshot showing a pop-over with interview insights in natural langauge, in sections “Overview”, “Strengths”, “Concerns”, and “Interviewer’s Overall Feedback”. Bottom right has an AI button “Regenerate” and a button “Close”.

Figure 4: AI-assisted interview insights in action with SAP SuccessFactors Recruiting. Alt Text: A short video (GIF) showing a user press the AI button “Generate” and showing the resulting insights, similar to what is shown in Figure 3.

Find out more:

  • 1H 2025: Revolutionizing Hiring Decisions with AI Interview Feedback Insights in SAP SF Recruiting.
  • Documentation: AI-Assisted Interview Feedback Insights.

 

Onboarding Made Easy with WalkMe

Jon got the job, and getting started is made easy for him with the onboarding checklist I featured in my February blog post. Now, when he starts using SAP SuccessFactors for the first time, to get some of his on-boarding tasks done, he gets built-in guidance via WalkMe, which explains applications step by step.

Figure 5 shows an example for when Jon opens up the Employee Profile, he gets an explanation about the purpose of the Profile Preview. Clicking on “Next” takes him to a brief explanation of the “Spotlight”.

Figure 5: An example of WalkMe providing guidance for SAP SuccessFactors users: first explaining the People Profile (upper image), then explaining the Spotlight (lower image). Alt Text: The upper image shows the People Profile for a user, with contact details on the left and cards for Skills, Competencies, Mentoring, Organization, About Me Video, Upcoming Absence on the right. A pop-over hovers above the list on the left with an explanation of the purpose of the People Profile and two buttons “Next” and greyed-out “Back”.

Easy-to-Understand Overview of Benefits and Payroll

Now that Jon is more familiar with SAP SuccessFactors, and has been on the job for a while, he’d like to get an overview of the various benefits he has enrolled in, along with details of his payroll, such as his pay statement along with pay related information. This is now easy with the enhanced People Profile in SAP SuccessFactors Employee Central, which provides quick access to the various parts of your benefits (Figure 6) and payroll information (Figure 7). These pages list all the relevant parts, with direct links for more information on each of them.

Figure 7: Payroll information in the enhanced People Profile in SAP SuccessFactors Employee Central. Alt Text: Screenshot of People Profile with the list of sections on the left, “Payroll” selected. On the right one card “Payroll” is shown, with a title “Payroll Information (1 of 3)” and a greyed out left-arrow button and a right-arrow button above a list of items and links.

Have a look at all the enhancements to People Profile in this video, or read about them in this blog post:

  • Video: 1H2025 release highlights – people profile (32 seconds)
  • First Half 2025 Release: What’s New in SAP SuccessFactors Employee Central?

Understand Pay Statements with Natural Language via Joule – also Mobile

Jon has used Joule from his browser to answer various HR questions, as well as for creating leave requests. Now, he can use Joule on the go with the SAP SuccessFactors mobile app – as I explained in my Part 1 blog post.

Jon had a look at his pay statement, via the enhanced People Profile we just talked about, and wasn’t quite sure whether he understood how it all fits together (something probably familiar to most people starting out in a job).  Fortunately, he can simply ask Joule to get a natural language explanation of the pay statement, as you can see in Figure 8.

Figure 8: Using Joule to explain your pay statement. Alt Text: An image of Joule showing a chat, with the first entry by the user being “Explain my pay”, followed by a text explaining the current month’s payslip in four sections “Gross Pay”, “Deductions”, “Net Pay” and “Employer Contributions”, and a reminder to check your payslip regularly to ensure tax code and other details are correct.

In figure 8, he simply asked “Explain my pay” and already got a concise summary  in natural language. He started asking “Why are my deductions so high?”. If you want to see how Joule responds to that, and more, watch:

  • Video: 1H2025 release highlights – explain my pay with Joule (35 seconds)

 

Learning Overview and Skill-Based Recommendations

Learning and Development in Enhanced People Profile

Jon is keen to progress in his career and learn more. The enhanced People Profile now includes a “Learning and Development” overview, as shown in Figure 9. Jon gets an overview of his development goals, assignments from the opportunity marketplace, learning history, and required learning, with links to more information and actions.

Figure 9: Learning and development information in the enhanced People Profile in SAP SuccessFactors Employee Central. Alt Text: Screenshot of People Profile with the list of sections on the left, “Learning and Development” selected. On the right four cards are shown: Development Goals, Opportunity Marketplace Assignments, Learning History, Required Learning. Each has a list of items each with links, and a card-specific link at the bottom to go the application for the card’s topic.

Skill-Based Learning Recommendations

Based on Jon’s skills and his respective proficiency levels, Jon can now look at a particular skill in the Growth Portfolio which he would like to develop further, and get a learning recommendation from SAP SuccessFactors in the “Opportunities to Grow” section. Get a 30-second glimpse of this at 1:59 in this video:

  • Video: SAP SuccessFactors 1H 2025 Release Highlights.

 

Managing Goals and Performance Reviews

Towards the end of the year, it’s time for performance reviews and setting up goals for the next year. With the 1H2025 release, we are introducing a brand new user experience for doing this, with a new UI and several AI-assisted capabilities to help Jon and his manager get this done efficiently with good outcomes.

Figure 10 shows the new UI for managing performance, where you can see your goals, your skills, your ratings and your manager’s rating along with ratings from others.

Figure 10: The new performance form experience in SAP SuccessFactors Performance & Goals. Alt Text: Screenshot of the new form for performance, with the left two-thirds starting with a section for generating AI-powered insights, then “Your Goals” and “Your Skills” as lists with a slider for each entry depicting the rating, columns for employee rating, gap, weight and comment. The goal “Increase sales by $100 million” has been selected. On the right details of the selected goal are shown, with sections “Rating and Comment”, “Ratings from Others” and “Linked Activity (2)”.

Jon’s manager finds it easier to craft helpful feedback by using the following new AI-assisted features:

  • AI-assisted comments, which uses the AI-writing assistant in order to help formulate comments.  (The AI writing assistant was first introduced a year ago, see my blog post from last summer).
  • AI-assisted feedback in performance reviews, which integrates rating context as well as user input to create recommendations for feedback texts.

To see the above in action, watch this:

  • Video: 1H 2025 release highlights - revamped performance form with AI (39 seconds).

Jon himself benefits from the new AI-based sentiment analysis for 360-degree reviews, shown in Figure 11. With this, he can quickly identify positive, negative or mixed feedback, as well as seeing which areas need improvement, thus aiding him in developing as a professional.

Figure 11: AI-based sentiment analysis for 360-degree reviews in SAP SuccessFactors Performance & Goals. Alt Text: A screenshot of the Detailed 360 Report in the background showing partly covered horizontal bar charts for ratings from Manager, Self, Direct Report/Peer/Other, All Except Self and All. The center contains a pop-over “Communicating Effectively – Comments” showing two anonymous comments, the first one labelled “positive”, the second one “mixed”.

 To find out more about all the exciting innovations in SAP SuccessFactors Performance & Goals, including the ones just mentioned, look at this blog post:

  • First Half 2025 Release: What is New for SAP SuccessFactors Performance & Goals?

 

AI-Assisted Offboarding and New Alumni Experience

With this release, we provide AI-assistance to employees who are departing, via AI-assisted offboarding through Joule. This helps employees complete their tasks, providing them with a well-structured offboarding experience.

The new alumni experience goes one important step further, by giving ex-employees access to personal information, documents and resources – and hence a much better overall user experience than before. Figure 12 shows the home page for alumni, giving them direct access to pay statements, profile, documents and personal information. They also get access to payroll and tax-related documents.

Figure 12: The new alumni home page in SAP SuccessFactors Onboarding. Alt Text: Image of the home page with a banner across the whole top with the text “Good Morning” , below that a section “Quick Action” with tiles for seven actions, such as “View My Pay Statement”, “View Company Documents”, and a section “Organizational Updates” with four cards with news for alumni.

Get more information here:

  • Video: 1H 2025 release highlights - alumni experience (34 seconds).
  • 1H 2025: Alumni, AI-Assisted Offboarding & Mass Initiation in Onboarding.

 

Further Information on 1H2025 Release Highlights

These three assets give you an overview of the overall release highlights for 1H2025:

  • SAP SuccessFactors HCM 1H 2025 Release Highlights.
  • Video: SAP SuccessFactors 1H 2025 Release Highlights (3:24 min.)
  • Video: Business AI in SAP SuccessFactors – 1H 2025 Release Highlights (3:43 min.).

These posts give details of innovations in the respective product areas:

  • What’s New in SAP SuccessFactors Employee Central : 1H 2025
  • First Half 2025 Release: What's New in SAP SuccessFactors Learning?
  • First Half 2025: What’s New in SAP SuccessFactors HCM Mobile Application
  • What's New in SAP SuccessFactors Onboarding: 1H 2025
  • First Half 2025 Release: What is New for SAP SuccessFactors Performance & Goals?
  • What’s New in SAP SuccessFactors Recruiting : 1H 2025
  • First Half 2025 Release: What's New in SAP SuccessFactors Time Management

 

Continue Reading - UX Innovations in SAP Ariba and SAP Fieldglass

I hope you enjoyed this fourth part, covering SAP SuccessFactors, with great new user experiences helping employees and managers work more efficiently and effectively. Here is the link to part five, covering latest UX innovations in SAP Ariba and SAP Fieldglass, i.e. applications for managing your spend (procurement) and external workforce:

  • SAP UX Q3/2025 Update - Part 5: SAP Ariba, SAP Fieldglass.

Part 1 of the series lists all the parts, and links to those parts that have already been published:

  • SAP UX Q3/2025 Update – Part 1: AI, Joule, SAP Build Work Zone, SAP Mobile Start.

Do keep posting your experiences and recommendations yourself in the SAP Community, with the SAP Fiori and/or the User Experience tag! In case you are wondering how to get a list of the most recent blog posts on SAP Fiori and User Experience in our new SAP Community, use these links:

  • Latest blog posts on SAP Fiori in the SAP Community.
  • Latest blog posts on User Experience in the SAP Community.

entry.title: From Automation to Intelligence: How Joule Studio is Shaping the Future of SAP
entry.content:
The year 2025 has marked a significant turning point in enterprise technology, with AI agents becoming integral to operations across nearly every business line. SAP has been at the forefront of this transformation, introducing groundbreaking innovations such as Joule Studio, designed to empower organizations with intelligent automation and seamless workflow orchestration. 

Automations and workflows are streamlining repetitive manual tasks, while AI agents are increasingly being used to perform tasks autonomously across various business lines. And industry leaders are demanding automations and AI agents to make sure they remain in the competition and do not miss out on the advantages that these solutions bring to the table. Joule Studio provides abilities to SAP developers and users to build, deploy and run Custom Joule Skills and Custom Joule Agents in a short span of time.

Joule Studio brings in ease of use by abstracting all the technicalities and providing an interactive UI to build Custom Joule Skills and Custom Joule Agents in on-the-go fashion in SAP Build. One of the features of Joule Studio is that it enables the creation of Custom Joule Skills. Custom Joule Skills are nothing but automations of any manual, repetitive and rule-based task like reading data from a website and updating the same in SAP HANA cloud database. Read about the difference between Joule Skills and SAP BPA automations in this FAQ Blog.

Custom Joule Skills thus built get utilised by Custom Joule Agents created in Joule Studio. Building a Custom Joule Agent is even easier than assembling Lego blocks. Joule Studio acts as a helper and instructor right from the start of interaction asking specifications and providing options to choose from. Please note that Custom Joule Agent building feature is currently in beta and expected to be released in coming months.

 

Why Joule Studio?

Joule Studio provides one-stop-shop for building ‘Joule Skills’ and ‘Joule Agents’ with an exceptionally user-friendly interface. A developer or user can interact with Joule Studio in natural language and get all the assistance needed for building Custom Joules Skills or Custom Joule Agents.

Another advantage of choosing Joule Studio over other non-SAP AI tools is that ‘Joule Studio’ understands SAP and its mechanism is deeply grounded in the business processes and the data of the SAP systems. This provides significant advantage when developing cross-module automation. Thus, providing seamless user-experience across or non-uniform SAP landscape.

Although Joule comes with lots of pre-built Joule Skills in various LOBs like Finance, Procurement etc., Joule Studio can be used now to build Custom Joule Skills adding user specific features and outcomes. The existing processes and workflows can be reused while building the Joule Skills. Security setup in Joule is based on principal propagation. Existing BTP setup can be used to configure security in Joule. Additionally, Joule Studio has features of data masking and data filtering for security and compliance purposes.

 

Prerequisites to setup Joule Studio -

Setting up Joule Studio has broadly three prerequisites. First, you should be subscribed to Joule. Second, subscription to SAP Build using build-default service plan is required and you should have an SAP BTP sub account with SAP Build Process Automation. Third, you should subscribe to SAP Cloud Identity Services in SAP BTP. This SAP documentation provides clear steps to setup Joule Studio.

What else can be done to make sure that we get business value out of Joule Studio based solutions?

Both Custom Joule Skills and Custom Joule Agents are built with the help of building blocks like existing workflows, automations, grounding data, business data and processes. Here are some of the ways to make sure that these are more efficient, insightful, and aligned with strategic goals –

  • Pay attention to the data. It should be accurate to reflect the real-world values. It should be complete and without missing values. The data should be consistent across the landscape for better insight. And the data should be up-to-date and available when needed.
  • To make automations and workflows more effective make sure that high-impact use cases are prioritized. The automations should be intuitive and transparent meaning these should minimize clicks and decision points and should provide visibility of the status of the ongoing tasks. Further, these should be designed to integrate across systems and should have embedded intelligence to provide improved outcomes based on data.
  • It is important to regularly measure and optimize automations. Have governance in place and finally promote the adoption by offering training and support.

To conclude, I recommend reading Michael Ameling's blog on Joule Studio.

entry.title: AI Copilots and the External Workforce: Reimaging the Future with Conversational Intelligence
entry.content:
In today’s fast-moving business landscape, where speed determines market leadership, the way organizations manage external talent is under intense scrutiny. Procurement and HR leaders are expected to deliver more—faster, smarter, and with greater accountability—but they’re often constrained by outdated, manual workflows that lag the pace of change. 

The rise of hybrid work, the surge in contingent labor, and the growing complexity of services procurement have created a perfect storm of operational friction. As pressure mounts to optimize spend, ensure compliance, and secure the right talent at the right time, the disconnect between executive expectations and system capabilities becomes increasingly clear — tools in place often deliver fragmentation, delays, and administrative burden. It’s no longer enough to simply digitize workflows. Executives are demanding real-time visibility, streamlined execution, and actionable insights.  

The current mandate is shifting from basic automation to intelligent orchestration powered by AI and copilots. Enterprise systems are no longer just expected to process tasks—they must evolve to anticipate user needs, guide decision-making, and unlock capacity at scale. Reflecting this shift, 44% of executives identify AI strategy and integration as a top priority for procurement teams over the next 12–18 months. 

As a leader in external workforce, SAP Fieldglass has taken a disciplined, strategic approach to artificial intelligence—one that prioritizes trust, transparency, and tangible business value. Focusing on deeply and seamlessly embedding it in the systems that power external workforce management. Delivering intelligence that understands the complexity of enterprise operations, respects data integrity, and scales with confidence. SAP Fieldglass’s AI is helping businesses run better by turning data into decisions, and decisions into outcomes. That’s what makes its approach essential for organisations navigating transformation at scale.  

 Joule and the Power of GenAI: Embedded Intelligence for Every Workflow 

The launch of Joule, SAP’s copilot, within SAP Fieldglass marks a transformative moment for organizations seeking to elevate their contingent labor and services procurement strategies. Joule is not just another tool—it’s a strategic enabler that redefines how practitioners interact with data, make decisions, and drive operational excellence. 

Joule introduces a conversational interface that allows users to interact with SAP Fieldglass in a natural, intuitive way. By shifting from manual navigation to intelligent dialogue executives and managers can now receive assistance with everyday tedious tasks – including multiple search and navigation enhancements, as well as assistance in the creation of job postings and SOWs – within contingent and Statement of Work (SOW) workflows, simply by engaging through a conversational interface. 

For users focused on speed and scale, Joule delivers a powerful suite of capabilities that streamline decision-making and execution: 

  • It guides users to best-fit templates and intelligently pre-fills key fields such as start dates. 
  • It retrieves complex reports—like quarterly budget and spend, worker headcount, and job postings—with ease. 
  • It quickly surfaces relevant help information from the SAP Help Portal site and actionable insights that would otherwise take hours to uncover. 

Together, these capabilities dramatically reduce time-to-action, minimize manual errors, accelerate the learning curve, and improve the overall user experience. Joule also enhances visibility and precision in workforce planning, empowering users to make informed decisions around vendor spend, talent allocation, and compliance risks. 

Joule is integrated directly into SAP Fieldglass, so it eliminates the need to toggle between systems or undergo extensive training, allowing teams to focus on outcomes rather than processes. This frictionless experience is particularly appealing to executives who value simplicity and efficiency in enterprise technology. 

Security and scalability are foundational to Joule’s design. Built within SAP’s trusted ecosystem, it adheres to rigorous governance standards, ensuring that innovation does not compromise compliance or unconscious bias. For organizations operating across geographies and industries, this means they can deploy Joule with confidence, knowing it meets the highest standards of data protection and operational integrity. 

SAP Fieldglass AI journey 

SAP Fieldglass has been at the forefront of integrating machine learning and artificial intelligence into its solutions for years. From intelligent resume assessments and skill-based candidate matching to automated job description creation, translation, and even SOW generation, SAP has consistently delivered AI-driven capabilities that enhance talent management and procurement processes. These innovations reflect a broader, ongoing commitment to embedding intelligence across the SAP ecosystem—an evolution that continues with the integration of Joule. 

SAP Fieldglass SOW Document AI is an intelligent document processing solution that streamlines the management of Statement of Work (SOW) documents within the SAP Fieldglass platform. Leveraging artificial intelligence and machine learning, it automates the extraction, classification, and validation of key data from SOW PDFs, such as job roles, deliverables, durations, and financial terms. This reduces manual effort, minimizes errors, and accelerates the onboarding and management of external workforce engagements. By integrating seamlessly with the Fieldglass ecosystem, SOW Document AI enhances compliance, improves data accuracy, and helps organizations make faster, more informed decisions when managing services procurement. 

In conclusion 

Looking ahead, Joule will include deeper analytics and expanded use cases across the SAP Business AI portfolio. This evolution will further empower leaders to harness AI in ways that are strategic, scalable, and deeply aligned with their organizational priorities.  

For executives ready to lead this transformation, Joule offers a unique opportunity to reimagine how work gets done. It’s not just about automation—it’s about unlocking new levels of insight, speed, and strategic control.  

SAP helps bring simplicity and clarity to all types of spending from all across a company. SAP invites customers and partners to take part in the transformation, shaping the future of intelligent workforce management together, so that you can take a step toward a smarter, more agile workforce. 

Interested to learn more or activate Joule in your environment?  

Reach out to your an SAP representative or Contact us today  

Please refer to the following screenshots for more details of the use cases  

1) Joule - Job Posting Template Selection

2) Joule - Report Search and Execution

3) Joule - Help Retrieval

entry.title: The Convergence of Enterprise Data and Gen AI in Oil, Gas and Energy
entry.content:
The Oil, Gas, and Energy team has made tremendous progress this year in advancing relevant AI solutions that drive operational efficiency and business transformation. Our efforts are focused not only on delivering value through targeted projects but also on building robust partnerships to expand our capabilities in agentic AI solutions. We are excited to highlight major initiatives currently delivered and in development.

1. Where Is My Stuff
Holistic Visibility Through Natural Language AI

Purpose

The first version of "Where Is My Stuff" was released in Q2 2025, adding a natural-language skill to Joule. This feature allows users to request the latest information on non-stock items managed in the Field Logistics solution using simple English, providing real-time visibility across locations through intuitive queries.

Key Benefits:

  • Speeds up access to critical procurement data, ensuring teams get the information they need without delays and eliminates manual navigation through multiple Field Logistics screens; answers appear instantly via chat.
  • Productivity gains as field personnel spend less time searching for data and more time acting on it.

Potential Impacts:

  • Faster, better-informed procurement and logistics decisions, leading to fewer material shortages or over-orders.
  • Reduced operational costs through time savings and avoidance of manual errors.
  • Delivers faster responses that elevate customer satisfaction and loyalty.
  • Unlocks cost savings through leaner, more efficient processes.

2. Zero Touch PRA
Automating Gas Plant Statement Processing with AI

Purpose:
Zero Touch PRA, anticipated for release in Q1 2026, streamlines how analysts upload gas plant statements across Natural Gas Liquids (NGL) sales with minimal manual involvement.

Key Benefits:

  • Slashes hours of tedious manual data entry, freeing you to focus on high-impact work.
  • Drives faster, more reliable data processing, streamlining operations from input to insight.

Potential Impacts:

  • Accelerated critical data analysis, enabling quicker, more informed decision-making.
  • Minimizes costly errors by reducing reliance on manual input.
  • Sharpens reporting and forecasting precision, ensuring stakeholders can act with confidence
  • Enables analysts to devote more attention to high-value tasks, such as interpreting trends and strategic planning.

3. Supply Chain Automation Agent
Empowering Business Users with AI-driven Fulfillment

Beyond our current solutions, our team is actively developing the Supply Chain Automation Agent. This tool is designed to allow business users to efficiently fulfill trade obligations and maintain inventory balance by streamlining activities such as nominations and ticket postings—directly empowering users with advanced automation.

4. Strategic Partnerships for Next-Generation AI Solutions

To accelerate downstream process automation and streamline field logistics, our team is partnering with AWS to develop multi-agents’ system. These solutions will help optimize both downstream and upstream supply chain operations increasing operational efficiency and reducing costs.

Additionally, in collaboration with Accenture and SAP, we are refining our methodology to ensure that customers are not only leveraging existing AI use cases but also engaging with us to identify new areas for value creation. This approach guarantees that our solutions remain closely aligned with the evolving needs of our client base, fostering continuous improvement and increased efficiency.

Looking Ahead

Our team is committed to delivering impactful AI-driven solutions while cultivating strategic partnerships that expand our ability to solve emerging industry challenges. We look forward to an exciting year ahead as we continue to innovate and deliver to our customers.

For any questions, please reach out to Sumit Shah (sumit.shah@sap.com) or Kelly Boyer (kelly.boyer@sap.com)

If you are curious to find out more and experience some of the mentioned advancements live, please save the date for our SAP for Energy and Utilities Espresso Session on AI updates for oil, gas, and energy, taking place on October 15th at 4:00 PM CET.

entry.title: SAP Platform and Data Summit 2025: Unlock the Future of Innovation | Register Now
entry.content:
SAP Platform and Data Summit 2025: Unlock the Future of Innovation with SAP Business Technology Platform and SAP Business Data Cloud | Register Now

Hello, SAP Community!

My name is Joanne Koh-Stewart, and I'm Director of Product Marketing for SAP Business Technology Platform. As we navigate an era where enterprise data management isn't just an asset—it's the foundation of every strategic decision—business leaders face an unprecedented challenge: How do you transform mountains of information into meaningful competitive advantage?

According to recent IDC research, organizations that successfully harness the power of SAP Business Technology Platform with business applications reported achieving annual benefits worth $13.88 million per organization on average. Yet, many businesses find themselves drowning in data complexity, struggling to connect the dots between various business applications, processes, and other IT investments for tangible business outcomes.

That's precisely why I'm thrilled to invite you to the SAP Platform and Data Summit 2025—an exclusive gathering designed for pioneering business leaders and IT experts ready to unlock the transformative power of intelligent data strategies with SAP Business Technology Platform and SAP Business Data Cloud.

 

The Reality Check: Where Most Organizations Stand Today

Picture this scenario that's playing out in boardrooms across industries. Your organization has invested millions in digital transformation initiatives. You've implemented many applications required for your business, collected vast amounts of data, and are now hopefully looking into utilizing various AI tools. Yet when you want to optimize business processes, increase sales, engage customers, and elevate employee experience, you’re lost on where to start.

Sound familiar? The challenge isn't technology—it's the strategic alignment of SAP Business Technology Platform and SAP Business Data Cloud with real business objectives. You're sitting on a goldmine of data, but the path to extracting value feels fragmented across different systems, departments, and decision-making processes.

The key lies in creating an intelligent, unified ecosystem where your SAP and non-SAP data, applications, and AI capabilities work in harmony. SAP BTP, coupled with SAP BDC and SAP Business AI, doesn't just solve technical challenges—it fundamentally reshapes how your organization thinks, learns, and competes in the market.

 

What Makes This Summit Different: Customer-Led Innovation

Unlike typical vendor conferences, the SAP Platform and Data Summit puts customer success stories at the center. You'll hear directly from IT decision-makers and business leaders who have navigated similar challenges you're facing today. These aren't theoretical case studies—they're battle-tested strategies with real business value.

The two-day format is intentionally designed for deep engagement. Day 1 focuses on hearing from customers and partners’ success stories, while Day 2 dives into collaborative workshops to learn and ideate. You'll leave not just with inspiration, but with concrete next steps tailored to your organization's unique digital transformation journey.

 

Four Essential Topic Tracks You'll Explore at the Summit

On Day 2, dedicated tracks are offered to address the most pressing challenges facing organizations today in a workshop setting. Each track combines strategic insights with practical implementation guidance from customers who have successfully navigated these transformations.


BTP for Clean Core
You: Your organization is managing a complex landscape of customizations that make system upgrades challenging and expensive. Every enhancement seems to create technical debt, and you're concerned about maintaining agility while preserving critical business functionality.
The Solution: Learn how SAP BTP enables you to extend SAP applications without compromising your core system integrity. Through customer success stories, you'll discover how organizations are leveraging the clean core principles to innovate rapidly while maintaining upgrade readiness and reducing long-term maintenance costs.

BUILD-ing AI Applications & Extensions
You: Your business needs and processes aren't always met by standard applications, but custom development is time-consuming and resource-intensive. Meanwhile, your development teams are under pressure to deliver solutions faster while maintaining quality, security, and scalability.
The Solution: Explore how SAP Build empowers both professional developers and business users to create applications and extensions rapidly. See real examples of organizations using low-code development to bridge capability gaps, automate processes, and create tailored user experiences that drive business value.

AI & Joule
You: Despite the industry's significant importance and heavy investment in AI initiatives, your organizations struggle to move beyond pilot projects to enterprise-scale implementations that deliver measurable business impact.
The Solution: Discover how SAP Business AI and Joule are revolutionizing business processes across industries. Through customer presentations, you'll witness how AI is being utilized to improve business workflows, enhance decision-making, automate complex tasks, and provide intelligent insights that drive strategic outcomes.

Business Data Cloud
You: Your organization has access to vast amounts of data from different systems, but each source speaks a different "language." Without a unified semantic model, your data remains fragmented and difficult to interpret, limiting your ability to leverage advanced analytics and planning capabilities that could transform your business performance.
The Solution: Learn how SAP Business Data Cloud harmonizes heterogeneous data into a coherent, business-ready semantic model with SAP Datasphere. Explore customer examples of organizations that have transformed disconnected data into actionable insights, enabling sophisticated analytics, predictive planning, and strategic decision-making across the enterprise with SAP Analytics Cloud.

 

Register Now: Space is Limited (and FREE!)

The Summit isn't just about learning new technologies—it's about positioning your organization to lead in the data-driven economy that's already here.

🌉Register for San Francisco →| September 11–12, 2025
Customer Presenters: AMD, Siemens Healthineers, Clorox, and more
Celebrity Speaker: Andre Iguodala

🏙️Register for NYC →| September 16–17, 2025
Celebrity Speaker: Bernie Williams, former NY Yankee and 4x World Series champion
Customer Presenters: Moderna, Johnson & Johnson, Conair, and others

🏢Register for Chicago → | September 23–24, 2025
Celebrity Speaker: Former Chicago Bear Matt Forte
Customer Presenters: Southern California Edison, Endress+Hauser, Rust-Oleum, and others

🍁Register for Toronto → | October 16–17, 2025
Celebrity Speaker: NHL celebrity speaker to be announced soon
Customer Presenters: Metrie and others

🍑Register for Atlanta → | October 22–23, 2025
Celebrity Speaker: Celebrity speaker to be announced soon
Customer Presenters: Colgate, Lucid Motors, Gerdau, and more

Whether you're at the beginning of your SAP journey or looking to maximize existing investments, this Summit will provide the strategic clarity, practical insights, and professional connections to accelerate your transformation.

Register now and join the exclusive community of leaders who are turning data complexity into competitive simplicity.

 

Let's Connect

I'll be attending the Summit in Chicago this year, and I look forward to connecting with fellow transformation leaders! Come prepared with your toughest platform and data challenges—this is your opportunity to collaborate with peers who are solving similar problems and SAP experts who can provide immediate guidance.

Now let's hear from you:

  • What's your biggest obstacle in scaling your platform and data initiatives?
  • How are you currently measuring the ROI of your SAP investments?
  • What would success look like if you could unlock the full potential of your enterprise data?

Share your thoughts in the comments, and let's start the conversation before we meet in person!

entry.title: The Complete Joule Studio Resource Hub: Everything You Need to Get Started
entry.content:
Access Joule Studio from the SAP Build Lobby.

 

Joule Studio, the latest capability in SAP Build, is a low-code/no-code environment designed for creating, deploying, and managing custom Joule agents and skills. These agents and skills, which are deeply grounded in business data, allow developers to optimize rule-based and dynamic workflows and drive precise business outcomes. Joule Studio offers an open and extensible framework to infuse agentic intelligence into business workflows that span across SAP and non-SAP systems.  

Since July, Joule Studio is generally available (GA) with the skill builder capability. This blog is your practical guide that compiles all the resources you need to understand the product and get started on building agentic AI in a structured way.   

Here’s a recommended step-by-step approach: 

  • Start with overview resources such as announcements and short videos to gain conceptual clarity 
  • Deepen your understanding with technical blogs and guided experiences 
  • Move to structured courses and other learning materials for hands-on experience. 
  • Try the live product 

 

Getting introduced 

Every product journey starts with a curiosity - what is the product, and why should I care? This phase is all about getting conceptual understanding about Joule Studio and its capabilities:   

  • Joule Studio Announcement Blog – Read the official announcement on what is being released and when 
  • Joule Studio Product Video – Two minutes overview of Joule Studio, showcasing its capabilities and unique value in enabling skills and agents for workflows across SAP and non-SAP systems 
  • Joule Studio: custom Joule skills GA blog - Read the GA announcement for the skill builder. Understand characteristics and step-to-step process for building a skill 
  • On-Demand Webinar – Watch the on-demand webinar to go a little deeper, understand key agentic AI use cases, and get a sneak peek at product capabilities: skill builder and agent builder with a demo  

 

Seeing Joule Studio in action 

Once you know what Joule Studio does, the next step is to see it in action. Watching real demos and guided experiences helps you visualize where it fits into everyday business tasks and what it can achieve: 

  • Guided Product Tour – Take a guided tour of Joule Studio to explore how you can build AI agents and Joule Skills with drag and drop simplicity to achieve specific business outcomes 
  • Interactive Value Journey: Skill Builder – See how to configure a Joule skill to connect SAP SuccessFactors with a third-party payroll system 
  • Interactive Value Journey: Agent Builder Vision – Design agents that plan, adapt, and act autonomously 
  • Custom Joule skill creation – demo video - Learn how to create a Joule skill to create an ID badge in a third-party system after a preliminary check in an SAP system 
  • Learning Journey: Introducing Joule Studio in SAP Build – learning course on Joule Studio and its capabilities 

 

Explore the product hands on 

 Ready to dig in? This phase is all about experiencing the product hands on. Here’s where you start experimenting, take on learning missions, and build skills at your own pace: 

  • Discovery Center Mission – Best practices for connecting systems and scaling your Joule skills 
  • Developer Tutorial: Build Your First Joule Skill – Deploy your first custom Joule skill that retrieves employee information from one system and uses that information in another system 

 

Get started  

This phase provides you essential documentation to help you set up and get started with Joule Studio: 

  • Partner spotlights - before you get started on your own use case, read about real world Agentic AI use cases and their implementation by our partners: Redwood, Pricefx, LeverX, and Sovanta  
  • How to get started blog - understand the step-to-step process: prerequisites, commercial details, and technical setup 
  • FAQ blog - answers to your frequently asked questions  
  • Technical Set up guide - technical set up needed to access Joule Studio within SAP Build 

 

Closing remarks

With this organized set of resources, you have everything you need - from understanding the product to getting fully set up. Whether you’re a beginner or advanced developer, these materials are designed to support you and answer your questions at every step. We can't wait to hear what you build with Joule Studio in SAP Build!

entry.title: Artificial Intelligence in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2508
entry.content:
With the 2508 release, SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition continues to embed Artificial Intelligence (AI) at the core of business processes, enabling organizations to work smarter, faster, and with greater confidence. This release brings new AI-assisted capabilities across finance, service, and user experience, empowering employees to make data-driven decisions, reduce manual effort, and focus on higher-value tasks. By combining embedded AI, generative AI, and SAP’s digital assistant Joule, SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2508 sets a new benchmark for intelligent ERP — helping businesses unlock efficiency, innovation, and resilience in the cloud.

 1. Joule Copilots

1.1. Joule for Business

In today's fast-moving digital landscape, businesses need solutions that simplify processes and enhance efficiency. SAP’s Joule for Business stands at the forefront of this transformation. By embedding artificial intelligence directly into SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition, Joule for Business acts as a digital assistant that helps users navigate complex tasks through natural language interaction. With its intuitive design and AI-driven functionality, Joule is not just an assistant—it’s a strategic partner for every business user.

Simplifying Service Contract Management with Joule for Business

For Customer Service Managers, Joule for Business is a game-changer. It allows managers to express their business needs using everyday language, eliminating the need for specialized technical knowledge. Joule then guides users directly to key service management applications, such as the Manage Service Contracts app, Service Management Overview, and Service Contracts Dashboard. The result? Users experience faster navigation, enhanced satisfaction, and improved operational efficiency. By providing seamless access to apps like Mass Processing of Service Contracts and Monitor Auto Renewal Logs, Joule ensures that service contract management becomes a streamlined and user-friendly process.

Streamlining Solution Order Management

Joule for Business also empowers Solution Order Specialists to work more effectively. By understanding business requirements expressed in natural language, Joule navigates users directly to relevant solution order management applications. Key apps such as Solution Orders Overview and Solution Order Profitability are now just a simple command away. This not only saves time but also allows specialists to focus on core activities, driving productivity and enhancing decision-making. Joule thus bridges the gap between user intent and system functionality, transforming solution order management into a more accessible and efficient workflow.

AI-Assisted Sales Order Status Check

Beyond navigation, Joule for Business delivers tangible value in sales operations. With its AI-powered sales order status check, Joule enables businesses to monitor whether sales orders are on track and identify any issues hindering fulfillment. By translating complex fulfillment statuses into plain language, Joule helps users quickly understand bottlenecks, view potential causes, receive resolution suggestions, and seamlessly navigate to the appropriate applications. This functionality improves efficiency and accelerates issue resolution, ensuring that sales processes remain agile and customer-centric.

Read more about Joule: https://www.sap.com/products/artificial-intelligence/ai-assistant.html

 

1.2. Joule for Consultants

Joule for consultants is a conversational AI assistant designed to accelerate SAP project delivery. It achieves this by providing instant guidance grounded in an unmatched knowledge base that is exclusive to SAP and expertly curated. This foundation includes over 200,000 pages of documentation, SAP Notes, Knowledge Base Articles, and terabytes of content from SAP Communities. By tapping into this authoritative source, consultants can get fast, specific answers to complex questions, supporting every phase of a project from discover to run and saving up to 1.5 hours per day.

Beyond its extensive knowledge base, Joule offers powerful SAP-specific code intelligence, built upon a fine-tuned model trained on 250 million lines of ABAP code. This enables consultants to generate code from natural language prompts and significantly reduce the time needed to interpret unfamiliar code by up to 40%. The combination of expert guidance and advanced coding assistance directly impacts project timelines. This acceleration can shorten a typical 12-to-18-month project by up to 14%, translating to a reduction of 1.5 to 2.5 months in the overall project cycle

Read more about Joule for Consultants: https://www.sap.com/products/artificial-intelligence/ai-assistant/sap-consulting-capability.html

 

 1.3. Joule for Developers

Joule for developers is a generative AI assistant embedded within the ABAP development tools to enhance productivity and accelerate the software development lifecycle. Its primary goal is to help developers write, test, and deliver optimized, bug-free code in ABAP Cloud in the shortest possible time. For developers working in environments like SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition, this translates into a significant reduction in the time and effort required for both writing and testing code, leading to a faster realization of value from their development work.

The assistant provides several key capabilities to achieve this. It offers predictive code completion to generate ABAP code directly in the editor and a Joule chat feature for getting support on development questions using natural language. It can also explain existing development objects or selected lines of code to improve comprehension. To enhance quality, Joule assists in generating and improving ABAP unit tests and can create test classes specifically for CDS entities, helping ensure robust and reliable applications.

 

2. General Availability of AI-assisted Features in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition

2.1. Simplify Asset Accounting with SAP Business AI and SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition

In the Finance domain, we're enhancing the user experience with AI-powered innovations that transform the way fixed asset data is interpreted and managed. One of the standout features of this release is the introduction of AI-generated explanations for fixed asset key figures. These insights are delivered in natural language and help users clearly understand the origins and calculations behind critical values such as depreciation and net book value. This capability simplifies interpretation, allowing users to grasp financial figures and value changes more quickly, enhancing productivity and reducing the time needed for recurring financial tasks.

Additionally, this innovation comes with AI-assisted asset master data creation, enabling users to enter data using simple conversational commands. This approach decreases the effort and time required for data entry and onboarding while improving accuracy and data governance through intuitive, user-friendly interfaces. SAP Business AI is central to these enhancements, providing detailed explanations and support that facilitate better decision-making and enhance user satisfaction. This release reaffirms SAP's commitment to delivering efficient and user-centric solutions in asset accounting.

 

2.2. Group Reporting: AI-assisted Financial Business Insights for Group Financial Statements Review Booklet

Building on the successful beta release in 2502, predefined AI-assisted business insights—also known as quick actions—are now generally available in the Group Financial Statements Review Booklet. These insights help streamline financial review processes by highlighting key figures, variances, and relevant context in natural language.

The Group Financial Statements Review Booklet, Cost Centers Review Booklet, and Project Financial Booklet – Professional Services now all include AI-powered business insights that enable faster analysis and easier interpretation of financial data. By reducing manual analysis effort and surfacing relevant context automatically, these booklets drive efficiency across various reporting tasks.

 

2.3. AI-assisted processing of incoming quality certificates with SAP Document AI

With the 2508 release of SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition, we are excited to introduce SAP Document AI, a groundbreaking innovation that integrates generative AI into quality management processes. This advanced AI feature revolutionizes the handling of incoming quality certificates, significantly enhancing operational efficiency for our customers. By automating the extraction of relevant information from both paper and digital documents and incorporating it into SAP workflows, SAP Document AI streamlines the processing of supplier quality certificates. This leads to substantial reductions in manual efforts, faster processing times, and minimized human errors. As a result, quality technicians are liberated from monotonous tasks, enabling them to concentrate on more strategic and value-adding activities, which, in turn, helps companies expedite stock releases, minimize inspection-related production delays, and enhance overall throughput.

Moreover, SAP Document AI enhances accuracy and reliability by automatically matching quality certificates with system records and updating their status, ensuring that no document is misplaced and compliance is consistently maintained. Additionally, intelligent error handling fortifies system resilience and trust. One of the most compelling features of this solution is its seamless integration into the SAP S/4HANA Cloud experience, offered as a ready-to-use capability that requires no custom development, thereby providing customers with immediate value and swift ROI. As we continue to incorporate AI, data, and automation into our ERP offerings, SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition serves as a cornerstone for smarter, more agile operations. The introduction of SAP Document AI exemplifies our commitment to supporting customers in future-proofing their business, driving continuous improvement, and fostering innovation.

 

2.4. Unlock seamless data access with AI-assisted easy enterprise search 

Accessing business data is now even more intuitive with the AI-assisted easy enterprise search, which allows users to search using natural language. Instead of navigating through complex structures, a simple query like “Show me sales orders overall status in process” or “Show me open sales orders that have a net value greater than 100 EUR” provides relevant results instantly.

The system adapts the search results based on the user’s role, ensuring that only the most relevant business objects are presented. This not only improves search accuracy but also accelerates insight extraction—making it easier to act quickly and confidently in a data-rich environment. To enable this feature, select the 'enable AI natural language search' checkbox in the user profile settings.

 

3. Beta Programs of New AI-assisted Features in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition

3.1. AI-assisted smart solution for situations in My Home

The SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2508 release brings a new dimension of intelligence to the user experience with the introduction of the AI-assisted smart solution for situations in My Home. Currently available in beta testing, this innovative feature simplifies the resolution of business-critical situations by dynamically guiding users through resolution steps—directly from the homepage.

This smart solution leverages generative AI to adapt the user interface in real time, presenting timely insights and suggested actions tailored to the specific business context. Designed to support fast, informed decisions, it transforms traditionally manual and multi-step tasks into a seamless, click-efficient experience.

Accessible from the SAP S/4HANA Cloud homepage, the solution enables situation handling in just a few clicks—significantly reducing the time and effort required to take action. Instead of navigating through multiple screens, users are presented with dynamic cards that surface key information and associated actions. These cards act as entry points to resolve issues directly, eliminating the need for in-depth navigation and enhancing day-to-day productivity.

The substantial benefits of this innovation include saving time, reducing complexity, and improving the quality of decision-making. Generative AI delivers context-aware recommendations and outcomes that are both trustworthy and relevant—built on enterprise-grade intelligence. This intuitive approach allows users to act confidently with minimal effort, ultimately boosting overall efficiency across key operational processes.

To illustrate its impact, consider a common example: a sales representative receives a notification that a sales quotation is about to expire. In a conventional workflow, the user would open the situation, navigate to the quotation, manually edit the details, save the changes, and then return to resolve the situation. With the AI-assisted solution in My Home, these steps are consolidated into a single, streamlined flow—demonstrating how user effort is minimized while responsiveness is maximized.

Join the SAP beta testing for the latest AI-assisted user experience features in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition. For more details, visit the Get Involved Early page to register and contribute to the evolving landscape of AI-driven business processes. 

 

3.2. AI-assisted smart personalization of My Home for applications 

Personalizing the My Home workspace becomes faster and smarter with the new AI-assisted smart personalization feature. Currently in beta testing, it allows users to tailor their applications and insight tiles using natural language.

Applications can be added in just two clicks, including a preview to confirm suitability. This streamlines customization, especially for new or infrequent users, by offering AI-powered suggestions, application descriptions, and live KPIs for dynamic tiles. The experience is intuitive and efficient, ensuring that personalization aligns with users’ daily workflows.

Interested in experiencing these improvements first-hand? Join the SAP beta testing for the latest AI-assisted features in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2508 and contribute to shaping future developments. For more information, see: Get Involved Early, and register today to help drive the evolution of AI advancements. 

 

3.3. AI-assisted easy fill 

Also in beta, AI-assisted easy fill reimagines how form fields are completed. Instead of manually searching for and filling out fields, users can enter data via natural language. The system intelligently matches input to the correct fields and provides a clear overview before confirmation.

This innovation saves time, reduces navigation complexity, and increases accuracy in form completion. With automatic field matching and editable previews, easy fill offers a new level of convenience for maintaining business objects efficiently.

SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2508 delivers a powerful set of innovations that bridge insight and action with the support of generative AI. Whether it's optimizing financial processes, enhancing personalization, or improving sustainability reporting, these features demonstrate SAP’s commitment to building a truly intelligent cloud ERP system.

Interested in experiencing this enhanced feature? Join the SAP beta testing for the latest AI-assisted features in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2508 and contribute to shaping future developments. For more information, see: Get Involved Early, and register today to help drive the evolution of AI advancements. 

 

3.4. AI-assisted payment exception analysis

In the Manage Automatic Payments app (App ID: F0770), a new AI capability enhances the process of analyzing payment exceptions after a payment proposal run. This feature not only provides natural language explanations of payment exceptions but also highlights relevant log entries and suggests resolution actions.

This innovation reduces the time spent investigating and resolving issues in payment proposals. By guiding users directly to the root cause and recommended next steps, the process becomes significantly more efficient—improving payment accuracy and minimizing delays in financial operations.

 

Explore Joule Base and AI-assisted Features for Free

With Joule Base Entitlement in the SAP Store, SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition customers can consume all of our Joule features in 2508 release for free. 

We’re also pleased to share that three recently introduced AI-assisted user experience innovations—easy enterprise search, easy filter, and smart summarization—are now available in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition at no additional cost. With SAP Cloud ERP Base AI Entitlement here, SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition customers  can consume Easy Filter, Smart Summarization and Enterprise Search for free. To get started, simply accept the SAP AI Terms. Once completed, we’ll reach out to enable these capabilities on your tenants, so you can immediately begin benefiting from more intuitive interactions, faster insights, and enhanced productivity

 

Explore everything about Artificial Intelligence in SAP Cloud ERP here.

 

Watch the replays of our SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2508 Early Release Series!

entry.title: Join the Beta: Understanding tax calculations with Joule
entry.content:
Are you ready to influence the future of tax localization in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition?

We’re inviting customers to participate in the beta testing program for a new Joule capability: Understanding Tax Calculations.

 

This feature, available for early access with release 2508.2, uses Generative AI to deliver real-time, contextual explanations of tax logic applied in posted sales orders. The current scope focuses on Sales Order-based tax calculations for India.

Billing clerks often spend valuable time interpreting tax rules to ensure compliance. This capability simplifies that process by providing clear, human-readable insights—directly within the application. The result: faster reviews, fewer errors, and greater confidence in tax accuracy.

As a beta participant, you’ll test the feature in your own SAP S/4HANA Cloud system and engage in regular feedback sessions with SAP’s development teams. Your input will directly shape how this AI-powered localization tool evolves.

Key Dates

  • Registration: July 1 – September 30, 2025
  • Program Start: October 20, 2025
  • Duration: 90 days

Seats are limited. To participate, you must be an SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition customer or partner and sign a Test Evaluation Agreement.

Ready to get involved? Check out the Beta Testing program page and click the Register button at the top left to secure your spot.

entry.title: First Experiences GenAI-driven extensibility assistant for Custom Fields and Custom Logic app
entry.content:
These are my first experiences with the extensibility assistant

Use within Custom Fields:


You can call the extensibility assistant in the Custom Fields app start screen, and in the details screen of a single custom field.

Calling the extensibility assistant in the start screen:

Example Prompt :Create a Z field in the Journal Entry Item Level , Field Name : Reference1 and Field Description : Reference 1_HD , Data Type : Char/Text Field Length : 20 and Enable it for the RAP BO I_JOURNALENTRYTP

In the initial screen of the Custom Fields app on the button bar at the top right of the custom field list, you'll find a open assistant button. 

Enter the prompt it will preselect Business context

 After selecting the right context accept the proposal from SAP it will create the field and enable to edit for detail screen 

Calling the extensibility assistant in the details screen:

  • On the button bar at the bottom of the screen, you'll find the diamond button.

  • if you want to ask about a custom field displayed on the details screen, you can refer to it using expressions like “this field”. A common use case is seeking assistance to expose the field through an OData service, UI, CDS view, or SOAP API.

  • Once selected Press save and publish manually . As you see from the below the field is automatically extended in the SOAP API section based on the prompt .

 

Use within Custom Logic:

  • Start the extensibility assistant in the Custom Logic app by clicking the Open Assistant button on the implementations table toolbar

 

  •  The extensibility assistant will show a list of BAdIs that fit your request or a message if no BAdIs were found. 

Select and create implementation . This will only help to find right BADIs not generation of the coding in the BADI 🙂
